0.title: What are the key facts on Indian incomes revealed in State of Inequality report?
0.article_body: As per the latest State of Inequality in India report, the total earnings of the top 1% (₹1,27,48,00,000) were three times that of the total earnings of the bottom 10% (₹32,10,00,000). The top 1% accounted for 6-7% of the total income earned in India while the top 10% got 30-35%. The bottom 50% earned around 22% of total income.

1.title: Haven't watched but know the story: Akshay on 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'
1.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar was asked at a media interaction about 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' starring Kartik Aaryan which is the sequel to his 2007 film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa'. The actor said that he has not watched the film yet but knows the story and is going to watch it soon. Kartik had earlier said that it's better if comparisons are not drawn.

2.title: Indian Coast Guard seizes 218 kg drugs worth over ₹1,500 crore
2.article_body: Indian agencies have arrested a gang of international smugglers and seized around 218 kilograms of heroin worth more than ₹1,500 crore off the Lakshadweep coast. The heroin was recovered from two fishing boats named "Prince" and "Little Jesus". The recovery was made during a joint operation conducted by Indian Coast Guard (ICG) and Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI).

3.title: I don't understand the term pan-India: Akshay Kumar on Bollywood vs South cinema debate
3.article_body: Akshay Kumar has reacted to the ongoing debate between South and Hindi cinema and said, "I don't believe in this divide.. We're all one industry." "I hope every film works...This word pan-India, I don't understand it," he added. I think the day we realise...we're one industry, things will start working better for us," Akshay stated.

4.title: Woman killed in attack by wild elephants in MP's Shahdol
4.article_body: Officials said that a couple sleeping outside their house in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district was attacked by a herd of wild elephants from neighbouring Chhattisgarh. "The woman was trampled to death by the elephants, while her husband escaped with minor injuries," said the Jaisinghnagar forest range officer. The deceased's family was given a compensation of ₹4 lakh, the official added.

5.title: Parts of Delhi-NCR receive rainfall, dust storm predicted tomorrow
5.article_body: Parts of Delhi and Gurugram received rainfall and strong winds on Friday, bringing some relief from the scorching heat over the past few days. Stormy weather with lightning was also reported from some areas of Noida. Meanwhile, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted a dust storm or thunderstorm with light to moderate rainfall in NCR on Saturday.

6.title: Depp's star power dimmer over unprofessional behaviour on set: Ex-agent
6.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp's former agent Tracey Jacobs has testified in the ongoing defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard, saying his star power "dimmed" due to unprofessional behaviour on sets. Tracey said that the crews loved him but would have to wait hours for him to arrive. Depp also asked United Talent Agency to give him $20 million, Jacobs added.

7.title: Indian Air Force rescues cancer patient from flood-hit Assam
7.article_body: The Indian Air Force (IAF) rescued a cancer patient who was returning after treatment and got stuck at Haflong railway station amid the floods in Assam. IAF officials said that the patient was shifted to a nearby area safely. The floods have affected over 3.31 lakh people in Assam's Nagaon district alone, Assam State Disaster Management Authority said.

8.title: China launches military drills amid Biden's first Asia trip as Prez
8.article_body: China has launched military drills in the disputed South China Sea amid Joe Biden's first visit to Asia as the US President. China's Maritime Safety Administration office said that other aircraft and vessels will be prohibited from entering the area. Notably, Biden's visit is largely focused on countering the perceived threat from China, according to a report.

9.title: Delhi govt raises DA for labourers, claims highest minimum wages in India
9.article_body: Delhi government on Friday raised the dearness allowance (DA) for labourers amid rising inflation. With this, the monthly wages for unskilled labourers have been raised from ₹16,064 to ₹16,506 and semi-skilled labourers' wages have been increased from ₹17,693 to ₹18,187 per month. "Minimum wages in Delhi are highest in comparison to any other state," Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia claimed.

10.title: Part of hill falls on J&K highway near tunnel collapse site, video surfaces
10.article_body: A day after an under-construction tunnel in Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban district collapsed, a part of a nearby hill caved in on the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway on Friday. The incident took place in the Makerkote area and a video of the same has also surfaced. One labourer has died while around nine others are still feared trapped in the tunnel.

11.title: Rishi Sunak, wife Akshata enter 'UK Rich List' with combined £730 million wealth
11.article_body: UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak and his wife Akshata Murty have been included in The Sunday Times Rich List of the UK's wealthiest 250 people for the first time. The couple has ranked 222nd in the list with a combined fortune of £730 million. Akshata Murty, the daughter of Infosys Founder NR Narayana Murthy, owns about 0.9% stake in Infosys.

12.title: Committed to ensuring security of Chinese nationals in Pak: PM
12.article_body: Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif said that his government is committed to providing the highest level of security to all Chinese institutions and nationals working in Pakistan. Sharif made the remarks in a statement issued after his meeting with a Chinese delegation led by External Security Commissioner Cheng Guoping. Notably, a terror attack in Karachi last month killed three Chinese teachers.

13.title: WHO calls for emergency meet amid rise in monkeypox cases: Report
13.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) has called for an emergency meeting to discuss the rapidly growing monkeypox outbreak, British publication The Telegraph said on Friday. This comes hours after France, Germany and Belgium confirmed their first cases. Other countries that have detected monkeypox cases include the UK, US, Portugal, Sweden, Spain and Italy.

14.title: I will play in IPL 2023, it'll be unfair to not play in Chennai & say 'Thank you': MSD
14.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni has said that he will "definitely" play in IPL 2023, adding, "It's a simple reason. It will be unfair to not play in Chennai and say 'Thank you'." He added, "Hopefully next year it'll be an opportunity where the teams will be travelling so it will be like a thank you to all the different venues."

15.title: Matthew Wade reprimanded for angrily throwing helmet and bat in dressing room
15.article_body: GT's Matthew Wade has been reprimanded for breaching the IPL Code of Conduct during his team's match against RCB at Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. Wade was seen angrily throwing his helmet and bat in the dressing room following his dismissal following a review for LBW. Wade has accepted the sanction, the IPL said.

16.title: I've forgiven everyone who hurt me: Indrani after being released from jail
16.article_body: Former media executive Indrani Mukerjea was released from a Mumbai jail on Friday, almost seven years after being arrested in her daughter Sheena Bora's murder case in 2015. "I am very happy," said Mukerjea while leaving Byculla Jail, adding, "Empathy and forgiveness...I have forgiven all the people who have hurt me." She said she has learned "a lot" in jail.

17.title: Ancient vase kept in kitchen in UK sells for ₹14 crore, pic surfaces
17.article_body: A rare 18th century Chinese vase bought in 1980s for a few hundred pounds has been auctioned for almost £1.5 million (over ₹14 crore). It was purchased by a surgeon and passed from the original owner to his son, who, not realising its true value positioned it in his kitchen. Its value was revealed when an antiques specialist spotted it.

18.title: Shastri's photoshoot pics go viral, says 'Family lives in Mumbai, I live in the moment'
18.article_body: Former India head coach Ravi Shastri took to Twitter to share pictures from a photoshoot, which later went viral with fans turning his posts into memes. Shastri captioned one of his pictures, "My family lives in Mumbai and I live in the moment." "Good mornings are optional if you haven't slept at all," he wrote alongside another picture.

19.title: It's in illegally-occupied area: Govt on reports of 2nd Chinese bridge on Pangong
19.article_body: The government has issued a statement on reports of a second Chinese bridge being constructed across the Pangong Lake in Ladakh by China. "Both these bridges are in areas that have continued to be under illegal occupation of China since the 1960s," said the government. "We've never accepted such illegal occupation of our territory," it added.

20.title: Vendors caught littering leftover flowers fined: Hyderabad Mayor
20.article_body: The Mayor of Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation said that vendors and other persons were fined after they were caught littering leftover flowers, despite repeated notices served to them. Hyderabad Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal added that the intention behind this was to keep the surroundings tidy. "Swachh Survekshan is everyone's social responsibility," she tweeted.

21.title: Nepal reports its first cases of African swine fever
21.article_body: Nepal has reported its first cases of African swine fever, the World Organisation for Animal Health (OIE) said on Thursday. The fever has so far killed 934 pigs in six municipalities in Kathmandu Valley, according to a OIE report. The country has 1,426 susceptible and 1,364 active cases of the fever as of Thursday evening, the report said.

22.title: CSK to bat first against RR in their last IPL 2022 match, Rayudu returns to playing XI
22.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni won the toss and elected to bat first against RR in their last IPL 2022 match on Friday. Both the teams have made one change each to their playing XIs. Ambati Rayudu returns to the playing XI for CSK in place of Shivam Dube, while Shimron Hetmyer has replaced Jimmy Neesham in RR's playing XI.

23.title: Oscar-winning Greek composer Vangelis dies at the age of 79
23.article_body: Greek composer Vangelis, who won Oscars for the music of 'Chariots of Fire' and 'Blade Runner', died aged 79 on Tuesday. As per reports, Vangelis died in a hospital in France where he was being treated for COVID-19. The composer had homes in London, Paris and Athens. Vangelis was self-taught in music and claimed he never learnt to read notes.

24.title: Gyanesh Bharti appointed as Commissioner of Unified MCD
24.article_body: The Home Affairs Ministry has announced that 1998 batch IAS officer Gyanesh Bharti has been appointed as the Commissioner of the Unified Municipal Corporation of Delhi. Meanwhile, Ashwani Kumar has been appointed as the Special Officer in the Unified MCD. The South, North and East civic bodies will be treated as one Municipal Corporation of Delhi from May 22.

25.title: Man killed with an axe in Palghar, accused arrested
25.article_body: Police said that a 28-year-old man identified as Sainath Jadhav was killed with an axe at Nalasopara in Maharashtra's Palghar in the early hours of Friday. The victim was killed by 18-year-old Roopesh Thackeray when Jadhav tried to rescue his relative from being attacked, the police added. The accused was later arrested by Mira-Bhayandar, Vasai-Virar Police.

26.title: Massive fire at godown in Delhi's Jhandewalan, 27 tenders reach spot
26.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a godown in the Jhandewalan area of Delhi on Friday. As many as 27 fire tenders reached the spot and the blaze was brought under control. Informing about the same, Delhi minister Satyendar Jain said that no injuries or casualties were reported in the fire, which reportedly broke out at around 2.05 pm.

27.title: Pune civic body to set up centralised command centre for civic issues
27.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is setting up Integrated Command and Control Centre (ICCC) to address all civic grievances. The ICCC will also act as a centre to monitor disaster management and traffic movement, according to a report. "It would be citizen oriented and enable quick response to citizens' concerns," Deputy Municipal Commissioner Pratibha Patil said.

28.title: 2 held for extorting ₹18,000 by posing as policemen in Bhayandar
28.article_body: Two men who posed as policemen and extorted ₹18,000 from a grocer were arrested by Bhayandar Police. The incident occurred on May 3 when the victim was on his way to deliver goods and was stopped by the duo, who accused him of selling banned gutka. They then snatched the money from him and fled.

29.title: Former Mumbai Police officer Sachin Waze's bail plea rejected
29.article_body: Former Mumbai Police officer Sachin Waze's bail plea in connection with a money laundering case filed by Enforcement Directorate was rejected by a special court. Through his lawyer, Sachin Waze sought bail, saying he was not arrested during the probe and keeping him in custody was unnecessary. ED prosecutor said other crimes registered against Waze should be considered.

30.title: I request Sehwag to be mindful while making such statements: Akhtar on 'chucking' remark
30.article_body: After Virender Sehwag stated Shoaib Akhtar used to chuck while bowling, the ex-Pakistan pacer said, "I'd request Sehwag to not pass such comments. If Sehwag knows more than ICC...he's entitled to his opinion." He added, "Cricketers should make sure their statements don't disturb...harmony between India & Pakistan. I request Sehwag to be mindful while making such statements in...social media age."

31.title: India's annual FDI inflow hits all-time high of $83.57 billion in 2021-22
31.article_body: India's annual FDI (foreign direct investment) inflow hit an all-time high of $83.57 billion in the financial year 2021-22, the Ministry of Commerce & Industry said on Friday. The Ministry said that the highest-ever annual FDI inflow has been recorded despite military operation in Ukraine and COVID-19 pandemic. In 2020-21, the FDI inflow in India stood at $81.97 billion.

32.title: Depp was controlling, said I got a scratch from sex with another person: Ex-girlfriend
32.article_body: Johnny Depp was jealous, controlling and frequently drunk, his ex-girlfriend, actress Ellen Barkin, said in testimony. "I had a scratch on my back once that got him very, very angry because he insisted it came from me having sex with a person who wasn't him," she added. Barkin said she had a brief "sexual relationship" with Depp in the 1990s.

33.title: 16 pvt schools to shut in GB Nagar for operating without recognition
33.article_body: GB Nagar's education department released list of 16 private schools which were running without recognition certificates in the district and directed for their closure with immediate effect. The private schools that have been found violating the rules are located at Garhi Chaukhandi, Mamura, Raipur Bangar, Maincha, Nangla Nainsukh, Salarpur, Madalpur, Jhajhar Road, Bhaipur Brahmanan and Wajidpur.

34.title: Jet Airways gets DGCA nod to resume flight operations after 3 years
34.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has granted the air operator's certificate (AOC) to Jet Airways, allowing the grounded carrier to resume commercial flight operations after three years. The airline successfully conducted all its proving flights, reportedly with DGCA officials onboard, this week. Earlier, the Ministry of Home Affairs had granted security clearance to Jet Airways.

35.title: ₹25,000 monthly salary is among top 10% incomes earned in India: Report
35.article_body: A monthly salary of ₹25,000 is among the top 10% of incomes earned in India, The State of Inequality Report released by the Economic Advisory Council to the PM (EAC-PM) has said. Citing the 2018-19 and 2019-20 data from the Periodic Labour Force Survey, the report said nearly 15% of the working population earned less than ₹5,000 per month.

36.title: Got bruises on arms, legs shooting 'Designer': Divya Khosla Kumar
36.article_body: Actress-filmmaker Divya Khosla Kumar, who was seen in 'Designer' with Guru Randhawa and Yo Yo Honey Singh, said that she got bruises on her arms and legs while shooting. "There was one outfit...made out of...metal. Along with that...I had inches long nail extensions...I couldn't sit during the shoot because of my outfit! It was a...shoot of seven hours," she added.

37.title: HC orders company to pay ₹10 lakh to terminated employee in B'luru
37.article_body: Karnataka HC has directed a Bengaluru-based company to pay a ₹10 lakh compensation to the employee who was terminated after he declined to undergo a performance improvement program. Since the employee was terminated without holding an enquiry, he's eligible for compensation, it said. However, it didn't allow his reinstatement to the job due to loss of mutual trust with employer.

38.title: Seema drops 'Khan' surname after filing for divorce from Sohail
38.article_body: 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' star Seema has dropped the 'Khan' surname from her social media accounts and returned to her maiden name Seema Kiran Sajdeh. This comes a week after she filed for divorce from actor-filmmaker Sohail Khan after 24 years of marriage. Rumours about their separation began when the couple was shown as living separately on the show.

39.title: Amazon, Flipkart in talks to buy stake in $1.1 bn Metropolis Healthcare: Report
39.article_body: Diagnostics chain Metropolis Healthcare is reportedly looking to raise over $300 million and bring onboard a strategic partner by selling a significant minority stake. While Flipkart and Apollo Hospitals are among potential investors, Amazon has held preliminary discussions, Bloomberg reported. Metropolis currently has a market value of $1.1 billion, about half of what it was at the start of 2022.

40.title: Dave Chappelle's attacker charged with attempted murder in separate case
40.article_body: Isaiah Lee, who attacked comedian Dave Chappelle onstage during a performance with a replica gun and knife, has been charged with attempted murder in a separate case. The 23-year-old allegedly stabbed his roommate during a fight at a transitional housing apartment in December last year, police said. Police added that publicity from Dave Chappelle's attack helped them solve this case.

41.title: 18-year-old girl dies as her burqa gets stuck in bike wheel in Hyd
41.article_body: An 18-year-old girl fell from a motorcycle after her burqa got stuck in the motorcycle's rear wheel in Hyderabad. She received major injuries and succumbed to death, while her brother, who was driving the motorcycle, survived the accident with no injuries. Sharing a video of the accident, TSRTC MD, VC Sajjanar, tweeted, "Women...be careful when you sit on a bike."

42.title: SC lifts stay on Delhi HC order on right to feed stray dogs
42.article_body: Supreme Court has vacated a stay on the Delhi High Court order, which said that "stray dogs have the right to food and citizens have the right to feed them". The verdict comes as a relief to animal welfare organisations involved in feeding stray dogs. The Supreme Court had put the stay on the HC order on an NGO's plea.

43.title: Rachakonda Police conduct awareness programme for poultry workers
43.article_body: She Teams of Rachakonda Police conducted an awareness programme in Vanasthalipuram regarding cybercrimes, human trafficking, gender sensitisation, child marriage, child labour and child abuse. The awareness programme was conducted for poultry farm workers of the locality, who were asked to dial 100 if they came across such incidents. The Rachakonda Police tweeted about the awareness programme.

44.title: Pune's SPPU prepares development plan for Sindhudurg district
44.article_body: Eighteen departments of Pune's Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) have prepared a development report for Sindhudurg district. "We have chosen this district considering...climate change and the need for infrastructure," the project's coordinator said. Notably, the report highlights road connectivity as a major challenge and recommends building of cold storage facilities to promote aquaculture.

45.title: Happy that people have accepted the choices I made: Kartik Aaryan
45.article_body: Kartik Aaryan, while talking about choosing a particular role or a film, said he is happy that people have accepted the choices he made till date. "It's the energy that people are catching up on," he said. Further, while talking about breaking his image of a monologue boy from 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama', Kartik said that he made conscious decisions.

46.title: Margot Robbie to star in 'Ocean's Eleven' prequel movie: Reports
46.article_body: Margot Robbie is set to play the lead role in a prequel to the crime drama film 'Ocean's Eleven', according to reports. Jay Roach, who previously worked with Robbie in film 'Bombshell', has been roped in to direct the forthcoming project, reports stated. 'Ocean's Eleven', which was released in 2001, featured Brad Pitt, George Clooney and Julia Roberts, among others.

47.title: Ketan Mehta, Anubhav Sinha team up for film on freedom fighter Usha Mehta
47.article_body: Filmmakers Ketan Mehta and Anubhav Sinha have teamed up for 'Freedom Radio', an upcoming film based on the life of freedom fighter Usha Mehta. It'll be helmed by Ketan, while Anubhav will be producing it under his production banner Benaras Mediaworks. Usha Mehta started a radio station, Secret Congress Radio, during the Quit India Movement in 1942.

48.title: MP man arrested for making 7,000 fake Aadhaar cards in Hyderabad
48.article_body: Officials said that a man who had fled after making over 7,000 fake Aadhaar cards in Hyderabad, was arrested by the police's Cyber Cell in Indore. Police said that the accused, Pawan Kotiya, who had two cases registered against him, was handed over to the Hyderabad Police. His eight aides were arrested by Hyderabad Police a few days ago.

49.title: She's a far-left actor: Musk on friend of air hostess who accused him of sexual harassment
49.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said the friend of the flight attendant who has accused him of sexual harassment "is a far-left activist/actress in LA with a major political axe to grind." In a report, the flight attendant's friend accused Musk of exposing himself and offering to buy a horse for her friend in exchange for an erotic massage in 2016.

50.title: CSK made a lot of mistakes, captaincy issue created lot of confusion: Akhtar
50.article_body: Talking about CSK, former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar said, "They have made a lot of mistakes and their dressing room never looked intact in IPL 2022." "The captaincy issue created a lot of confusion," added Akhtar. "CSK's management didn't look serious about IPL 2022. If MS Dhoni leaves they are left with nothing," he had earlier stated.

51.title: Nearly 2,000 Ukrainian fighters in Mariupol have surrendered: Russia
51.article_body: Nearly 2,000 soldiers holed up in Mariupol's Azovstal steelworks, the last bastion of Ukrainian resistance in the city, have surrendered to Russian forces so far, Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu said. Those who have surrendered have been taken to Russian-controlled areas. Ukraine, which is aiming to secure a prisoner swap, said efforts are on to evacuate the remaining defenders.

52.title: Rapper Lil Nas X to be honoured with 2022 Hal David Starlight Award
52.article_body: Rapper Lil Nas X will be honoured with Hal David Starlight Award at the 2022 Songwriters Hall of Fame ceremony. The award recognises young songwriters making significant impact in the music industry through their original songs. At the age of 23, Lil Nas X will become one of the youngest recipients of the award after Taylor Swift and Nick Jonas.

53.title: Nigerian man arrested with 400 gram of MDMA worth ₹60 lakh in Mumbai
53.article_body: The Anti-Narcotics Cell of Mumbai's Bandra arrested a Nigerian man from Goregaon and recovered 400 gram of MDMA from his possession. According to Datta Nalawade, DCP, Anti-Narcotics Cell, the seized drug is worth ₹60 lakh in the international market. Earlier in April, another Nigerian national was arrested in Mumbai with 750 gram MDMA worth ₹1.12 crore.

54.title: Sexual harassment story meant to interfere with Twitter acquisition: Musk
54.article_body: After a report claimed Tesla CEO Elon Musk allegedly sexually harassed a flight attendant employed by SpaceX in 2016, he said that the story was meant to "interfere with the Twitter acquisition". Responding to a follower who asked if he responded to the writers of the story, Musk replied, "The story was written before they even talked to me."

55.title: Trolling part of life: Dalip on Big B, Akshay's trolling over pan masala
55.article_body: Veteran actor Dalip Tahil has reacted to Amitabh Bachchan and Akshay Kumar being trolled over endorsing pan masala brands, saying that trolling is a part of life. "If you don't want to be trolled, don't go on social media," the actor added. Dalip further said that trolling is also publicity for some actors who were not recognised before social media.

56.title: Poonam Dhillon's daughter Paloma to debut opposite Sunny Deol's son Rajveer
56.article_body: Actress Poonam Dhillon's daughter Paloma Thakeria is set to make her Bollywood debut opposite Rajveer Deol, the younger son of actor Sunny Deol, in Rajshri Productions' upcoming project. It will also mark filmmaker Sooraj Barjatya's son Avnish Barjatya's debut as a director. The yet-untitled film is reportedly set against the backdrop of a lavish destination wedding.

57.title: There's not a lot that has gone my way in IPL 2022: RCB's Maxwell
57.article_body: RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell said there is not a lot that has gone his way in IPL 2022, having scored 268 runs so far in the ongoing edition. "To be able to influence the game in different areas of the contest is what I try to do," added Maxwell. The all-rounder has scored one half-century till now in IPL 2022.

58.title: Kept searching for fours despite a close shave: Harbhajan on Kohli's 73 vs GT
58.article_body: Discussing RCB batter Virat Kohli's 73 off 54 balls against GT, ex-India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh said, "Kohli fought...and in an interesting fashion." "There was a close shave...a catch was dropped in the deep but that didn't stop his attitude. He kept on searching [for] fours, the day he searches [for] fours Kohli's attitude is like this, attacking mode," added Harbhajan.

59.title: He's been going to temples for yrs: Man who was booked for taking pet dog to Kedarnath
59.article_body: A Noida man booked for allegedly hurting religious sentiments by making his pet dog touch an idol at the Kedarnath shrine said he's been taking his pet dog to temples for the past four years. "Why is this drama happening now suddenly?" said Vikash Tyagi on Instagram. He also shared an old video of his dog at Badrinath and Tungnath.

60.title: Archer ruled out of English summer 2022 after suffering back stress fracture
60.article_body: England pacer Jofra Archer has been ruled out of this year's English summer due to a lower back stress fracture. The England and Wales Cricket Board confirmed that the 27-year-old pacer will not be available to play until the end of September at the earliest. However, no timeframe has been set for Archer's return, ECB said.

61.title: 3 held for assaulting man on suspicion of theft in Gwalior
61.article_body: Three persons were held for allegedly thrashing a man on suspicion of theft in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior. A video had surfaced where the accused had tied the victim, covered his eyes and assaulted him in the Falka Bazaar area, Gwalior SP Amit Sanghi said. Notably, the arrests were made after the police questioned some people from the area.

62.title: Kangana Ranaut buys Mercedes Maybach worth over ₹3 crore, pic surfaces
62.article_body: Kangana Ranaut on Thursday attended the premiere of her upcoming film 'Dhaakad' and unveiled her latest purchase, the Mercedes Maybach S680 worth over ₹3 crore. Pictures and videos of Kangana unveiling her new car have been shared online. A video shows Kangana clapping as two people removed the cover of the car.

63.title: Soni Razdan joins the cast of 'Brown' alongside Karisma Kapoor, Helen
63.article_body: Actress Soni Razdan has joined the cast of Abhinay Deo's upcoming film 'Brown'. The film also stars Karisma Kapoor and Helen in key roles. "An eclectic set of characters are part of...story. I was [compelled] to come out of my comfort zone," Soni said. Produced by Zee Studios, 'Brown' is a neo-noir crime drama set in the city of Kolkata.

64.title: Student molested inside coffee shop in JNU campus, probe underway
64.article_body: A female student was allegedly molested inside the coffee shop of the Jawaharlal Nehru University campus in Delhi. The complainant alleged that the accused asked her whether both of them can stay together before he started "performing sexual act" on her. Notably, police have launched the probe and the FIR has been lodged under IPC Sections 354 and 354-B.

65.title: Navjot Sidhu surrenders at Patiala court after getting 1-year jail term
65.article_body: Navjot Singh Sidhu, who was sentenced to one year in jail for a 1988 road rage incident that killed a man, has surrendered before Chief Judicial Magistrate in Punjab's Patiala. "He is under judicial custody. Medical examination and other legal procedures will be adopted," said Sidhu's media advisor Surinder Dalla. He had earlier requested time to surrender on medical grounds.

66.title: My sons used to ask, 'Why's papa home, doesn't go to work?': Bobby
66.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol has said in an interview that he took a break from acting after welcoming his sons Aryaman and Dharam in 2001 and 2004, respectively. The actor added, "(They would ask) 'Why is papa home? Why doesn't he go to work?' And when I heard them say that, I didn't want to set a bad example for them."

67.title: Thailand to lift curbs on nightlife from June as COVID cases decline
67.article_body: Amid declining COVID-19 cases, Thailand has said that it will allow entertainment venues, pubs, karaoke bars and massage parlours to remain open until midnight from June. "These businesses should take a universal prevention approach...staff must have received booster doses and take antigen tests every seven days," Taweesin Visanuyothin, a spokesman for the government's COVID-19 taskforce, said.

68.title: 8 task forces to be set up to monitor developmental work in B'luru
68.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has said that eight task forces will be constituted for all the zones in Bengaluru to monitor developmental work. He said the task forces will be headed by a minister, while MLAs, MLCs and MPs will be its members. They'll have powers to take decisions whenever there's any emergency like heavy rains and floods, Bommai added.

69.title: Prepping for radiotherapy, I'm a bundle of nerves: Chhavi Mittal
69.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal, who recently underwent surgery after being diagnosed with breast cancer, has shared a post talking about prepping for radiotherapy. She wrote, "I won't deny I'm a bundle of nerves. Not for the prep but for the cycles to begin from Monday." The actress further wrote that her immunity is at an all-time low.

70.title: 17-yr-old boy rapes, impregnates 13-yr-old sister in Hyderabad; arrested
70.article_body: Police arrested a 17-year-old boy for allegedly raping his 13-year-old sister and impregnating her in Hyderabad's Bachupally. The matter came to light when the girl told her mother about missing her periods. She took her to a doctor who found she was 18 weeks pregnant. She later revealed that her brother had been sexually assaulting her for past two years.

71.title: A director called me after seeing Dhaakad poster & asked 'Is that you?': Divya
71.article_body: Divya Dutta, speaking about her latest film 'Dhaakad', said, "After the posters were released the biggest director called...and said 'Is that you? Oh my god! You're unrecognisable'." "It's so amazing for an actor to hear something like this," said Divya, who is playing an antagonist in the film. Directed by Razneesh Ghai, it also stars Kangana Ranaut and Arjun Rampal.

72.title: Supreme Court transfers Gyanvapi Mosque case to higher court in UP
72.article_body: The Gyanvapi Mosque case will be heard by a higher court in UP, the Supreme Court ordered on Friday. The case has been transferred from Civil Judge (senior division), Varanasi to District Judge, Varanasi. A senior and experienced judicial officer of UP Judicial services will hear the case, the apex court said. It's hearing a plea challenging mosque's video survey.

73.title: Death toll due to landslides in Arunachal Pradesh rises to 8
73.article_body: The death toll due to landslides in Arunachal Pradesh amid heavy rains has increased to eight, police said. This comes after a 35-year-old woman's body was retrieved from the debris in the backside of a 'dhaba' in Itanagar after six days of a search operation. Three people died due to landslides in Kurung Kumey while another is still missing.

74.title: Meta planning to launch crypto-supported payments platform: Filings
74.article_body: Meta is planning to launch a payments platform with support for cryptocurrency, trademark filings revealed. Meta filed five applications in the US for a new platform called 'Meta Pay'. The applications seek licenses to operate as an "online social networking service" for investors allowing financial trades and exchange of digital currency, virtual currency and cryptocurrency, among other things.

75.title: 6 proxy candidates appear for CISF exam in Chhattisgarh, arrested
75.article_body: Chhattisgarh Police have busted a racket and arrested six people who were appearing as proxy candidates during the physical test of CISF recruitment exam in Durg. The gang was busted due to a "mismatch" of biometrics and "many more are likely to be arrested", district SP Abhishek Pallava said. Each candidate paid ₹5 lakh to clear the exam, he added.

76.title: 27-year-old NEET PG candidate dies by suicide ahead of exam in TN
76.article_body: A 27-year-old female doctor allegedly died by suicide in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore on Thursday, ahead of the NEET PG 2022 exam. The deceased had got married six months ago and was studying for the exam at her mother's house. The incident occurred after some of the woman's family members, including her mother, reportedly refused to let her skip the exam.

77.title: No ED summons yet, will cooperate in investigation: Raj Kundra's lawyer
77.article_body: Businessman Raj Kundra's lawyer has stated that he has not received any summons or communication from the Enforcement Directorate (ED) yet. The ED has registered a money laundering case against Kundra in connection with the production and circulation of pornography films. Kundra's lawyer further stated that it is Kundra's duty to cooperate with the investigation conducted by the ED.

78.title: Hardik Patel's exit from Congress ungraceful: Jignesh Mevani
78.article_body: Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani criticised Hardik Patel for resigning from Congress and said that his exit from the party was ungraceful as Congress party gave all the support to him. "You can have differences with the party. But it is inappropriate (for Patel) to say that the Congress is anti-Gujarat or anti-India," Mevani said. Patel resigned from Congress on Wednesday.

79.title: 3 Raj policemen injured as drunk wedding guests throw stones at them
79.article_body: A police sub-inspector and two constables were injured when some drunk guests at a wedding allegedly threw stones at them following a scuffle in Rajasthan's Kota, police said. As many as eight persons, including two women, have been detained, police added. They have been detained on charges of rioting and attack on a public servant, police further said.

80.title: Sensex jumps over 1,500 points to end at 54,326, Nifty closes above 16,250
80.article_body: The Sensex jumped 1,534 points or 2.91% to close at 54,326, while the broader Nifty climbed 456 points to settle above 16,250 on Friday. The benchmark indices rallied as Asian stocks jumped after China cut a key lending benchmark to support a slowing economy. All sectoral indices ended in the green with metal, pharma, and realty indices up 3-4% each.

81.title: Madhavan's 'Rocketry...' gets standing ovation at Cannes, video surfaces
81.article_body: R Madhavan's 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' received a standing ovation during its world premiere at the Cannes Film Festival on Thursday, a video of which has also surfaced. Following the film's premiere, Madhavan, who has directed and produced the film in addition to acting in it, said, "We couldn't have asked for...better stage to showcase this film. Thank you...very much."

82.title: Top US, Russian generals talk for 1st time since start of Ukraine war
82.article_body: Russia's Chief of General Staff Valery Gerasimov and US Joint Chiefs of Staff Chairman General Mark Milley spoke for the first time since the start of the invasion of Ukraine. They "discussed several security-related issues of concern", a US spokesperson said. Notably, this comes a few days after US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin spoke to Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu.

83.title: Had we come a year earlier in Goa, we might have done wonders: Azad
83.article_body: The Goa TMC announced an ad-hoc core committee of eight members on Thursday and during the announcement TMC Goa in-charge Kirti Azad said, "We are grateful to the people for allowing us to garner over 5 percent vote share." "Had we come a year earlier, we might have done wonders here. But then this is what it is," Azad added.

84.title: Man thrown 50 feet away as speeding bike hits him in Pune
84.article_body: An elderly man died on the spot after a speeding two-wheeler hit him on the Pune-Morgaon highway in Baramati on Sunday, according to a report. The man was reportedly crossing the road when the bike hit him, throwing him 50 feet away. Meanwhile, the driver of the two-wheeler has been arrested and a police case has been registered against him.

85.title: Selective leaks of Gyanvapi Mosque survey report must stop: Supreme Court
85.article_body: While hearing the Gyanvapi Mosque committee's plea challenging the court-ordered survey, the Supreme Court said that "selective leaks" of the survey commission's report must stop. Only the judge must open the report, the apex court said. Varanasi court had earlier removed Advocate Commissioner Ajay Kumar Mishra from the survey team for leaking information to the media through a private cameraman.

86.title: Describe any scars, tattoos not known: Musk on claims of 'exposing genitals' to air hostess
86.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to respond to allegations that he allegedly exposed his genitals to a flight attendant in 2016. He tweeted, "I've a challenge to this liar who claims their friend saw me "exposed"...describe just one thing, anything...(scars, tattoos) that isn’t known by the public. She won't be able to do so, because it never happened."

87.title: He's been going to temples for 4 yrs: Man booked for taking pet dog to Kedarnath
87.article_body: A Noida man booked for allegedly hurting religious sentiments by making his pet dog touch an idol at the Kedarnath shrine said he's been taking his pet dog to temples for the past four years. "Why is this drama happening now suddenly?" said Vikash Tyagi on Instagram. He also shared an old video of his dog at Badrinath and Tungnath.

88.title: It's 'golden era' for women actors, we're getting better roles: Madhuri
88.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit, in a recent interview, said it is a golden era for women actors as they're getting better roles these days. "Earlier, if you wanted to make something women-centric, it would be the same old trope, where you're either an avenging angel or...victim," she said. Today, women characters have their own flaws which make them good, Madhuri added.

89.title: Lalu Yadav, his family a symbol of corruption in Bihar: Sushil Modi
89.article_body: After CBI filed a 'land for railway job scam' case against Lalu Yadav, BJP leader Sushil Modi called Yadav and his family a symbol of corruption in Bihar. Modi claimed, "The modus operandi was...you give me land...I'll give [you] a Group D job in Railways. Here...land was first granted in someone else's name...after five-six years it was gifted to Yadav."

90.title: Russia to consider allowing citizens over 40 to join military
90.article_body: Amid the Ukraine war, the Russian Parliament said it'd consider a bill to allow Russians over 40 years of age and foreigners over 30 to join the military. This would enable the military to utilise the skills of older professionals, it added. Currently, only Russians aged 18-40 and foreigners aged 18-30 can enter into a first contract with the military.

91.title: Players start having doubts after a bad patch like that: Hesson on Kohli
91.article_body: After RCB batter Virat Kohli scored 73(54) against Gujarat Titans on Thursday, RCB Director of Cricket Mike Hesson commented on Kohli's "bad patch" in this IPL season. "When you go through a (bad) patch like that...he is only human...you do start to just have doubts...a little bit of luck tonight but he's certainly earned it," Hesson said.

92.title: Kante is Chelsea's Neymar, Mbappe, Salah, De Bruyne, Van Dijk: Tuchel
92.article_body: Talking about midfielder N'Golo Kante, Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel said, "He is our Mohamed Salah...our Virgil van Dijk...our Kevin De Bruyne...our Neymar Jr...our Kylian Mbappé." "Kante has played only 40% of the games so it is...a miracle that we...[are] third...[on the Premier League points table]," added Tuchel. "If you...have Kante 40% of the time it's a huge problem," stated Tuchel.

93.title: Always my dream to trend on Twitter: World Boxing C'ships gold medallist Nikhat
93.article_body: After winning the gold medal at Women's World Boxing Championships 2022, Indian boxer Nikhat Zareen said, "It was always my dream to...trend on Twitter and to achieve something for India at the world level is the biggest motivation." "The last two years were really difficult...as we couldn't train due to COVID-19," added Nikhat. Nikhat termed her parents as her inspiration.

94.title: RBI to transfer ₹30,307 crore as surplus to central government for 2021-22
94.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) board has approved the transfer of ₹30,307 crore as surplus to the central government for the accounting year 2021-22. It has further decided to maintain the Contingency Risk Buffer at 5.50%. The central bank's board also reviewed the current economic situation, global and domestic challenges and the impact of recent geopolitical developments.

95.title: BJP is using him: Raut on Raj Thackeray's postponed Ayodhya visit
95.article_body: After MNS chief Raj Thackeray postponed his proposed visit to Ayodhya, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut alleged that the "BJP is using the MNS chief" for political gain. Raut said, "I got to know from the media that...(MNS) cancelled some programs in Ayodhya. We would have supported them (MNS)...After all, there's a huge section of Shiv Sena supporters in Ayodhya."

96.title: 40-year-old woman killed by wild elephants in MP's Shahdol
96.article_body: A 40-year-old woman was killed in a late-night attack by a herd of wild elephants in a village in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district. The deceased, identified as Draupati Singh, and her husband (48) were sleeping outside their under-construction house when the elephants came in from the neighbouring state of Chhattisgarh and attacked them, forest officials said.

97.title: 4 men assault, rob commuter at Virar railway station in Mumbai; 2 arrested
97.article_body: A 37-year-old commuter was reportedly assaulted and robbed by four co-passengers at Mumbai's Virar railway station on Sunday. One of the accused started beating him up when the man entered the escalator. Once they reached the top, other accused hit him, snatched his gold chain and mobile and fled away. Based on CCTV footage, Railway Police arrested two of them.

98.title: Meme compares Jacqueline and Sona, singer tells trolls 'Stop degrading her'
98.article_body: Singer Sona Mohapatra reacted to a meme comparing Jacqueline Fernandez and her as 'Expectation vs reality'. "I'm not available on 'order' thankfully...Not on sale. My earlier tweet on her asked for youngsters not to be too. Stop making a...fool of yourself," she tweeted. Sona earlier shared she won't buy products endorsed by Jacqueline due to her ongoing involvement with ED.

99.title: US' economic growth poised to outpace China's for first time since 1976: Report
99.article_body: The economic growth of United States is poised to outpace China's for the first time this year since 1976, Bloomberg Economics wrote in a report. China, the world's second-largest economy, will grow just 2% in 2022 due to its Zero Covid policy, Bloomberg Economics reported. On the other hand, the US' gross domestic product (GDP) will increase 2.8%, it added.

100.title: I hit Johnny Depp many times, it was self-defence: Amber Heard
100.article_body: Actress Amber Heard, testifying in the ongoing defamation trial against her, admitted to hitting her ex-husband Johnny Depp "many times" to "defend herself". She added, "[I did it] if it meant I could get away...or the difference between a sore face and a broken nose." Depp is suing Heard over her 2018 op-ed claiming to be a domestic abuse survivor.

101.title: SC permits firms to export excavated iron ore from Karnataka mines
101.article_body: Supreme Court on Friday permitted mining firms to export their excavated iron ore from mines of Karnataka's Ballari, Chitradurga and Tumakuru. "Permission granted to the applicant to export iron ore...to countries abroad but in terms of Government of India policies," SC said. SC was hearing pleas of mining firms seeking the lifting of curbs on iron ore sale and export.

102.title: Cong's 'Chintan Shivir' failed to achieve anything meaningful: Kishor
102.article_body: Election strategist Prashant Kishor said that Congress' 'Chintan Shivir' in Udaipur only helped in "prolonging the status-quo" and "it failed to achieve anything meaningful". Earlier, Kishor was in talks with the Congress leadership to work for the revival of the party but later he declined the offer saying, "I couldn't have added anything to Congress."

103.title: Dolphins use coral as medicine to treat skin ailments: Study
103.article_body: According to a study, bottlenose dolphins may be self-medicating their skin ailments by rubbing themselves against coral reefs. Corals were found to contain bioactive metabolites with antibacterial, antioxidative and oestrogen-like hormonal properties, which could be helpful in skin treatments. Dolphins are prone to yeast, bacterial and viral pox infections exacerbated by global warming.

104.title: Businessman arrested for bogus ITC claim of over ₹7 crore in Pune
104.article_body: Maharashtra government's GST Department has arrested a Pune-based businessman, Pravin Gundecha, for an alleged bogus Input Tax Credit (ITC) claim of over ₹7 crore. "Gundecha procured bogus invoices of taxable value at ₹41 crore without receiving any goods or services and thus availed wrongful ITC of ₹7.38 crore," an official release said. He has been remanded to 14-day judicial custody.

105.title: Electricity official seeks ₹5,000 bribe to replace pole in Pune; held
105.article_body: A 57-year-old executive engineer of the Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) has been arrested after he allegedly demanded a ₹5,000 bribe for replacing an electricity pole in Pune. The district unit of the state Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) filed a case after confirming that the accused had taken a reduced bribe of ₹3,000 after the initial demand.

106.title: Adivi Sesh reacts to Major's clash with Akshay's Prithviraj & Haasan's Vikram
106.article_body: Actor Adivi Sesh opened up about the box-office clash between his upcoming film 'Major', Akshay Kumar-starrer film 'Prithviraj' and Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram'. "Practically, Major is the biggest film in Telugu. Vikram is the biggest film in Tamil and Prithviraj is the biggest film in Hindi. But, while there are big fishes in the sea, we're the goldfish," Adivi said.

107.title: China opposes Canada's plans to ban Huawei, ZTE from 5G network
107.article_body: China has said it is opposed to Canada's plans to ban the use of 5G equipment from China's Huawei and ZTE to protect national security. China said it will take all necessary measures to "safeguard the legitimate interests of Chinese firms". China's embassy in Canada said the alleged security concerns were a "pretext for political manipulation".

108.title: Now actresses don't innovate enough, they look the same: Asha Parekh
108.article_body: Veteran actress Asha Parekh has stated that actresses nowadays don't innovate enough. She added, "If they even dressed up differently from others, they would not all look the same." The actress further said there is too much exposure of actors due to social media. "If you're not seen much in public, people are inquisitive to know about you," she added.

109.title: Biden arrives in South Korea on his first trip to Asia as Prez
109.article_body: US President Joe Biden arrived in South Korea on Friday on his first trip to Asia after taking office. Biden will meet South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol at a Samsung Electronics plant, the first meeting between the two leaders. On Sunday, Biden will arrive in Japan, where he will meet PM Narendra Modi on the sidelines of Quad summit.

110.title: Canadian MP Chandra Arya speaks in Kannada in Canadian Parliament, video viral
110.article_body: Canada's Indian-origin MP Chandra Arya spoke in his mother tongue Kannada in the Canadian Parliament on Thursday and shared a video that has since gone viral. "This is the first time Kannada is spoken in any parliament...outside India," said Arya. He quoted lines from a poem, which translated to 'wherever you are, however you are, be a Kannadiga forever'.

111.title: PM must defend nation: Rahul on China building bridge in Ladakh
111.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday reacted to reports of China building a second bridge on Pangong Tso lake in Ladakh, saying, "India's national security and territorial integrity [are] non-negotiable...[PM Narendra Modi] must defend the nation." This comes after Ministry of External Affairs said that it's "closely" monitoring the situation. "A timid and docile response won't do," Rahul added.

112.title: Payal attends 'Dhaakad' premiere, says 'Kangana wasn't happy to see me'
112.article_body: Payal Rohatgi on Thursday attended the premiere of Kangana Ranaut's 'Dhaakad' and shared some pictures from the event on her Instagram handle. "Rangoli (Kangana's sister) you're such...good human being...But your sister wasn't happy to see me...she was sulking," she wrote. Payal, who was part of Kangana Ranaut-hosted show 'Lock Upp', recently criticised her over the way the show was conducted.

113.title: Raj Thackeray postpones Ayodhya visit amid protests by BJP leaders
113.article_body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena chief Raj Thackeray on Friday took to Twitter to inform that he has temporarily postponed his proposed visit to UP's Ayodhya on June 5. The decision comes amid protests by certain BJP leaders and activists against his visit to Ayodhya. The BJP leaders were demanding Thackeray's unconditional apology for his remarks made against North Indians in 2008.

114.title: Musk offered to buy her a horse for erotic massage: Flight attendant's friend
114.article_body: In a declaration, the friend of the flight attendant who has accused Elon Musk of sexually harassing her said that he called her "for a full body massage" and exposed his genitals to her on a flight in 2016. She said he rubbed her leg and "offered to buy her a horse" if she provided him with an erotic massage.

115.title: Accused in 2019 Hyd vet's rape and murder case were deliberately killed by police: Panel
115.article_body: The Sirpurkar commission report in the 2019 Hyderabad veterinarian's murder and rape case has said that the accused were "deliberately fired upon with intent to cause death". According to police, the accused were taken to recreate the crime scene during which they allegedly tried to escape after attacking the police. Police had claimed the accused were killed in self defence.

116.title: Voyager 1 spacecraft from 1977 facing mysterious issue: NASA
116.article_body: NASA's Voyager 1 spacecraft, launched in 1977, has encountered a mysterious issue, the agency said. It said that while the probe is operating normally, the readouts from the attitude articulation and control system, which control the spacecraft's orientation in space, don't match up with what Voyager is actually doing. The issue hasn't triggered any onboard fault protection systems.

117.title: 9 new cabinet ministers take oath in Sri Lanka amid economic crisis
117.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa swore in nine new Cabinet members on Friday, among them ministers for health, trade and tourism. Earlier this month, veteran politician Ranil Wickremesinghe took over as PM to form a new cabinet after the President's elder brother, Mahinda Rajapaksa, resigned from his post over his handling of the economic crisis in the country.

118.title: N Korea claims 'good results' in COVID fight as fever cases top 2 mn
118.article_body: North Korea has said that it is achieving "good results" in its fight against its first confirmed COVID-19 outbreak. North Korea has reported over 2.24 million cases of "fever", while 65 people have died amid a nationwide outbreak of COVID-19. North Korea has not specified how many of those people with fever have been confirmed to have contracted the coronavirus.

119.title: Police raids illegal arms factory in UP's Ballia, 3 arrested
119.article_body: An illegal arms factory was busted by the police in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia district. Three people have been arrested while materials used for making arms were seized from the factory, Superintendent of Police RK Nayyar said. Notably, the accused are identified as Pintu Paswan, Golu Verma and Sachin Rajbhar. However, the operation was conducted with the help of a tip-off.

120.title: Disheartening, why wasn't I there: Hina on not being invited to Cannes' India Pavilion
120.article_body: Actress Hina Khan, who walked the red carpet at Cannes Film Festival, expressed her displeasure at not being invited to the inauguration of the India Pavilion. Speaking to Film Companion, she said, "It's a bit disheartening, why was I not there?...I could've been there, probably in the audience, at least, cheering for them." Hina further said she doesn't "envy them".

121.title: 4 people stabbed & injured in 'random' attack in Norway; suspect held
121.article_body: At least four people were stabbed and injured in a "random" attack in southeast Norway on Friday, police said. One of the victims is in critical condition, officials said, adding that the suspect has been arrested. The attack comes two days after a Danish man pleaded guilty to stabbing five people to death last October in a Norwegian town.

122.title: Pratik to play Mahatma Gandhi in series based on Ramachandra Guha's books
122.article_body: Actor Pratik Gandhi will play the role of Mahatma Gandhi in an upcoming multi-season series. The series will be based on historian Ramachandra Guha's two books, namely, 'Gandhi Before India' and 'Gandhi: The Years that Changed the World'. "Playing the role of Mahatma is very close to my heart ever since my theatre days," Pratik said about the project.

123.title: I've been receiving threats to life, family: Bose after Zilingo fires her as CEO
123.article_body: After Singapore-based B2B fashion startup Zilingo fired Ankiti Bose as CEO, Bose said she "will pursue our rights against this witch-hunt to the full extent of the law". She also said that she has been receiving online threats to her life and family. Zilingo had earlier suspended Bose on the basis of an anonymous whistleblower complaint over alleged financial irregularities.

124.title: Tried to take pressure off Virat: Maxwell on his 40*(18) vs GT
124.article_body: After scoring 40*(18) against Gujarat Titans, RCB batter Glenn Maxwell said that he tried to "take pressure off" his partner at the other end, Virat Kohli. "I didn't want to soak up any time. If I could get those first couple (of balls) away..we can keep the momentum going...[if out on 1st ball] wouldn't have made a difference," Maxwell said.

125.title: Fantastic: PM Modi on Nikhat Zareen winning World Boxing gold medal
125.article_body: Reacting to Indian boxer Nikhat Zareen winning the gold medal in the 52-kg category at the Women's World Boxing Championships 2022, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted, "Our boxers have made us proud! Congratulations...for a fantastic...win." "I also congratulate Manisha Moun and Parveen Hooda for their bronze medals in the same competition," he added in the tweet.

126.title: Results of Class 12 Karnataka board exams to be out in 3rd week of June: Nagesh
126.article_body: Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh has said that the results of the state's Pre-University Course exams (Class 12) will be announced in the third week of June. "The PUC exams have been successfully conducted and the valuation process will begin next week and the results will be announced in the third week of June," Nagesh said.

127.title: Aimed at spreading false propaganda: India on Pak minister's J&K remarks at UN
127.article_body: India has criticised Pakistan's Foreign Minister Bilawal Bhutto's remarks on J&K at the UNSC, calling them "unwarranted". Counsellor in India's Permanent Mission to the UN Rajesh Parihar said, "[The remarks] symbolise...pavlovian response aimed to misuse any forum...to propagate false, malicious propaganda against my country." 'No amount of propaganda' can deny that J&K is India's part, he added.

128.title: Kohli won't take any rest even if told to do so: Ex-selector Sarandeep
128.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli being potentially rested for Team India's upcoming T20I series against South Africa, former selector Sarandeep Singh said, "I don't think Kohli will take any rest even if someone tells him to." "I find this idea of taking rest during the national side's matches quite odd...If they want rest they can take it during IPL," added Sarandeep.

129.title: SC gave justice: Azam Khan's son on his father's bail order
129.article_body: After the Supreme Court granted interim bail to SP leader Azam Khan, his son Abdullah Azam Khan said, "Supreme Court delivered justice." "I am very happy (with SC's order). Will go to Rampur directly (after the release)," said Adeeb Azam Khan. The SC granted bail to Azam Khan two days after UP government urged the court to deny the same.

130.title: Woman, 2 kids rescued as fire breaks out in building in Delhi
130.article_body: A 28-year-old woman and her children, aged two and four, were rescued after a fire broke out in a building in Delhi's Palam Colony by police personnel. "The fire broke out on the ground floor...woman was shouting...from the roof," DCP (southwest) Manoj C said. "During the probe, it was found...fire broke out due to a short circuit," DCP added.

131.title: 9 killed as fire breaks out after tanker-truck collision in Maha's Chandrapur
131.article_body: At least nine persons were charred to death as a fire broke out after a collision between a tanker carrying diesel and a truck carrying wood in Maharashtra's Chandrapur, police said. The accident occurred on Thursday around 10.30 pm on Chandrapur-Mul Road, police added. The bodies of the victims were taken to a hospital, Chandrapur Sub-Divisional Police Officer said.

132.title: Bengaluru records its lowest min temp in May since 1945 at 17.9°C
132.article_body: Bengaluru on Friday recorded its lowest minimum temperature in the month of May since 1945 at 17.9°C, according to the India Meteorological Department data. In the May of 1945, the city had recorded the lowest minimum temperature of 16.7°C, the data showed. Earlier this week, two labourers died as the city witnessed heavy rainfall which led to flooding.

133.title: Can finally use 'Elongate' as scandal name: Musk amid sexual misconduct claims
133.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has tweeted, "Finally, we get to use Elongate as scandal name. It's kinda perfect." He quote-tweeted his own tweet from last year where he had suggested calling any scandal about him 'Elongate'. This comes after a report claimed that he allegedly sexually harassed a SpaceX flight attendant in 2016. Musk has called the claims "utterly untrue".

134.title: It was hectic: Hegde after losing her outfits, makeup before Cannes red carpet
134.article_body: Pooja Hegde has revealed that she lost all her luggage carrying her outfits, makeup and hair products before her red carpet appearance at Cannes. She said, "We couldn't cry about it because we didn't have time to do that….My team ran, they got new hair products, new makeup...I had my first meal...in the night...It was pretty hectic...We did disaster management."

135.title: Meta asks staff to not discuss abortion on internal chat due to 'increased risk'
135.article_body: A Meta executive asked employees to refrain from discussing abortion on Workplace, an internal social media platform, citing it as "an increased risk", as per a report. The top Meta executive also said abortion was "the most divisive and reported topic" by employees on Workplace. This comes after the US Supreme Court draft leak proposed abolishing abortion rights nationwide.

136.title: Shashi Tharoor posts chart comparing prices of daily items in 2014 and 2022
136.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Friday posted a chart comparing the prices of daily commodities like rice, wheat, milk, oil, and vegetables in 2014 and 2022. "One more difference between the UPA era & the NDA: you feel it daily!" he wrote. Tharoor used #Inflation along with the chart.

137.title: Maruti to set up third Haryana plant, project to create 11,000 jobs
137.article_body: Maruti Suzuki India Limited (MSIL) will set up a new plant in Haryana's Kharkhoda which is going to be the automaker's third plant in the state. "Maruti Suzuki purchased land in Kharkhoda due to the better environment in the state," MSIL Chairman RC Bhargava said. Maruti's new project will reportedly create 11,000 jobs and will cost ₹18,000 crore.

138.title: Fix goals for 25 yrs, work consistently for people: PM Modi to BJP workers
138.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday asked the party workers to set goals for the next 25 years and continue working consistently for the country's people to fulfil their aspirations. "The people...are looking at BJP with great confidence and...hope," he said. "Every citizen wants to see...work getting done. In this backdrop, the responsibility of government increases tremendously," he added.

139.title: TikTok tests letting users play games on app in Vietnam: Report
139.article_body: TikTok has been conducting tests allowing users to play games on the app in Vietnam, Reuters reported. It could expand the gaming feature to more regions in Southeast Asia as early as third quarter. TikTok said it has tested bringing HTML5 games to its app through tie-ups with third-party game developers and studios, but didn't mention its plans for Vietnam.

140.title: Hyd Traffic Police issues advisory in view of Amberpet flyover work
140.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police on Thursday issued an advisory in connection with the construction of the superstructure work of the Amberpet flyover. As per the advisory, the route between Golnaka Junction to Amberpet 6 Number Junction will remain closed from May 20 till the completion of the Amberpet flyover works. The traffic police also suggested alternate routes for motorists.

141.title: High Court halts cutting of trees in Delhi till June 2
141.article_body: Delhi High Court on Thursday halted the cutting of trees in the national capital till June 2. "Tree felling...not permitted till the next date...to ensure that felling is done only when it is fully assured...trees would at least be transplanted," it said. HC was informed that more than 29,000 trees have been cut or transplanted in Delhi in three years.

142.title: Once co-star criticised my comedy skills, couldn't do it for a long time: Archana
142.article_body: Archana Puran Singh revealed that one of her co-stars in show 'Mr Ya Mrs' criticised her comedy skills, saying that she didn't know how to do comedy. "He felt...making certain expressions wasn't...comedy," she said, adding she couldn't do comedy for a long time after that because she used to "feel diffident" thinking she'll not be able to make people laugh.

143.title: Farmer dies after he sets self on fire over police inaction in UP
143.article_body: A 45-year-old farmer succumbed to his injuries on Thursday after he set himself on fire outside Uttar Pradesh's Budaun SP's office over alleged police inaction. The deceased was apparently upset over the police not filing an FIR against his relatives, whom he suspected of having set his crop on fire. Following this, an FIR was filed against eight people.

144.title: Australia reports 1st case of monkeypox in traveller from UK
144.article_body: Australia on Friday reported its first monkeypox case in a man in his 30s who recently returned from the UK. A probable case was also identified in Sydney in a man in his 40s who had recently travelled to Europe, authorities said. Cases of monkeypox have been identified in several non-endemic countries, including the US, Italy, Portugal, Spain and Canada.

145.title: I was jealous of Shabana as she used to get all the nice parts: Neena
145.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta said in an interview that initially, she was "jealous of Shabana Azmi" because "she used to get all the nice parts". "There were many other actresses also. Sometimes I was told that we're doing this role but was thrown out from it," Neena said, adding that she's "much calmer" now because she's getting good parts to play.

146.title: He is a treasure: Ravi Shastri on Kuldeep Yadav's 2/14 against PBKS
146.article_body: Reacting to DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav's figures of 2/14 against PBKS, former India head coach Ravi Shastri tweeted, "Kuldeep is a treasure to be looked after." "Well done captain [Rishabh Pant] for giving him the confidence," added Shastri in his tweet. Kuldeep accounted for the dismissals of Liam Livingstone and Harpreet Brar. DC defeated PBKS by 17 runs.

147.title: Opp'n will think if 400's enough with Shaw, Pant in Indian Test side: Sehwag
147.article_body: Former India opener Virender Sehwag said opposition will think whether scoring 400 would be enough, if opener Prithvi Shaw and wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant feature together in India's Test side. "Shaw and Pant in one team could help India rule Test cricket [and] win [the] World Test Championship," added Sehwag. "Shaw...can bring back the excitement in Test cricket," stated Sehwag.

148.title: SC directs Pegasus probe committee to submit report by June 20
148.article_body: Supreme Court has granted an extension to the committee probing the Pegasus spyware case and has directed it to submit the report by June 20. The court will hear the matter next in July. The committee told SC that it examined 29 mobile devices suspected of infection by Pegasus. It also issued notices to government agencies and other relevant persons.

149.title: Stonehenge inhabitants ate internal organs of cattle: Study
149.article_body: The analysis of 4,500-year-old faeces of humans who inhabited Stonehenge showed that they ate offal. Researchers have found evidence of eggs of parasitic worms in the faeces, which they believe shows these people ate the internal organs of cattle. They lived at a Neolithic settlement situated 2.8 km from Stonehenge and are also thought to have built the monument.

150.title: We are still the no. 1 side: Hardik Pandya on GT's 8-wicket loss vs RCB
150.article_body: GT captain Hardik Pandya said his team is still the number one side in IPL 2022 despite their defeat against RCB by eight wickets. "[We] have defended the most number of totals while bowling second. We must have done reasonably well with the bat," added Hardik. Hardik scored 62* off 47 balls against RCB at a strike rate of 131.91.

151.title: Kishan exposed facing high-quality fast bowling vs SRH, it's a worry: Hayden
151.article_body: Former Australia opener Matthew Hayden said MI opener Ishan Kishan was "exposed" while facing high-quality fast bowling against SRH, adding it is a worry. "[At] the highest level, you...[will face] a lot more of that type of bowling," stated Hayden. Discussing Kishan's dismissal, Hayden said the batter was under pressure following a bouncer on the previous delivery by Umran Malik.

152.title: BJP sees reflection of Indian culture in every regional language: PM Modi
152.article_body: Speaking on the controversies around making Hindi as the national language, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "BJP sees a reflection of Indian culture in every regional language and considers them worth worshipping." "In past few days, we have seen that attempts are being made to spark controversies...We have given importance to every regional language in NEP," the PM added.

153.title: Attempt to muzzle a strong voice: RJD as CBI raids places linked to Lalu
153.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Alok Mehta criticised the raids conducted by CBI at multiple locations linked to former Bihar Chief Minister Lalu Prasad Yadav. "This is an attempt to muzzle a strong voice. CBI's...actions are completely biased," Mehta said. Opposing the raids, Lalu's brother Prabhunath Yadav said, "It's unfortunate that a person who is ill is being deliberately troubled."

154.title: Zilingo fires CEO Ankiti Bose after suspension over financial irregularities
154.article_body: Singapore-based fashion startup Zilingo has fired CEO Ankiti Bose after previously suspending her over alleged financial irregularities. In a statement, the company said that Bose was ousted "with cause" after an investigation led by an independent forensics firm. Meanwhile, Bose in a separate statement said her employment was terminated on grounds of "insubordination".

155.title: We are going to die, that will happen 100%: SL man as PM warns of food shortages
155.article_body: After Sri Lanka's PM Ranil Wickremesinghe warned of food shortages amid the economic crisis, a man working as a part-time chauffeur said, "Without food we are going to die. That will happen hundred percent." "There is no point in talking about how hard life is. I can't predict how things will be in two months," a woman selling fruits said.

156.title: 20-yr-old man gets life sentence for killing employer in Hyderabad
156.article_body: A local court in Hyderabad sentenced a 20-year-old man to life imprisonment for killing his employer. The accused, identified as Vikram, reportedly bore a grudge against his employer for not paying him a good salary. In October 2020, Vikram barged into his employer's home and attacked him with an iron rod. Vikram had also attacked the victim's wife and daughter.

157.title: Authorities demolish 48 houses in MP town after clash during wedding procession
157.article_body: Madhya Pradesh's Rajgarh administration demolished 48 houses on Thursday, two days after stones were hurled at a Dalit man's wedding procession. The attack took place allegedly after members of the Muslim community objected to DJ music being played in front of the mosque. Notices were issued to people after their homes were identified as an encroachment on government land.

158.title: 86% of Dia Free Juice users reduced high blood sugar in 2 months: Kapiva
158.article_body: Kapiva Academy of Ayurveda claims 86% of Dia Free Juice users observed a drop in high blood sugar while 74% reduced their dependency on daily diabetes medication. The juice is a potent combination of Karela, Giloy, Belpatra, and Vijayasar, which improves insulin utilization, controls sugar level fluctuation, regulates metabolism, boosts energy levels, and supports weight management, Kapiva added.

159.title: Kanika Kapoor to marry NRI businessman, shares pics from mehendi ceremony
159.article_body: Singer Kanika Kapoor took to Instagram to share pictures from her mehendi ceremony. Kanika is getting married to NRI businessman Gautam. Sharing the photos, she wrote, "G I Love you sooooo much!" This is her second marriage after she reportedly divorced businessman Raj Chandok in 2012, with whom she has three children.

160.title: Rahul asks Cong workers to help those affected by Assam floods
160.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has urged all his party workers and leaders in Assam to provide assistance in relief operations in the recent floods and landslides that have taken place in the state. "Lakhs of people are affected by severe flooding," Gandhi tweeted. Notably, over 7 lakh people have been affected by the calamity, Assam State Disaster Management Authority said.

161.title: Shanghai detects new infections after 5 days of zero COVID-19 cases
161.article_body: China's financial hub Shanghai on Thursday reported new COVID-19 cases outside quarantined areas for the first time after five days of no infections. All three people who tested positive in Xujing Town in Qingpu district were triple-vaccinated and were from the same family, authorities said. The town's over 2,00,000 people have been re-tested and all results were negative, they added.

162.title: Wild accusations untrue, it never happened: Musk on sexual harassment claims
162.article_body: Reacting to the sexual harassment allegations against him, Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted that the "wild accusations are utterly untrue." He added, "I've a challenge to this liar who claims their friend saw me "exposed"...describe just one thing, anything at all (scars, tattoos) that isn't known by the public. She won't be able to do so, because it never happened."

163.title: Our challan will meet him soon: Mumbai Police on picture of man taking selfie on road
163.article_body: Reacting to a complaint shared by a Twitter page called 'mumbaimatterz' in which a man can be seen taking selfie on his scooty in the middle of a road, Mumbai Police said, "Our challan will meet him soon." Retweeting the picture of the man, the police wrote, "Ab inhone bulaya hai toh jaana hi hoga...mauka bhi hai...kanoon bhi!"

164.title: SpiceJet flights stopped over non-payment of dues at Delhi airport
164.article_body: The Delhi ATC had stopped several SpiceJet flights on Friday as the airline did not make the requisite daily payment to the AAI. The ATC was instructed not to give clearance to the flights to take off as the payment was not made. SpiceJet said the payment failed due to a glitch in the software through which it makes payment.

165.title: What is Twitter's new 'crisis misinformation' policy?
165.article_body: Designed to tackle "situations of armed conflict, public health emergencies, and large-scale natural disasters," the policy ​will help hide tweets that share false information during such situations. While Twitter said it would rely on various credible sources to check if a tweet is misleading, it will also prioritise adding warning notices to viral tweets and tweets from high-profile accounts.

166.title: B'luru Customs intercept parcel with ₹20 lakh-cannabis; 1 arrested
166.article_body: Bengaluru Customs tweeted on Thursday that its officers intercepted a parcel that originated from the US at the Foreign Post Office and detected cannabis worth approximately ₹20 lakh. It said that one person, who was caught during the controlled delivery operation, has been arrested and remanded to judicial custody. The seized cannabis weighs 950 gm, it added.

167.title: Sri Lanka closes schools, limits work amid fuel shortage
167.article_body: Sri Lanka on Friday closed schools and asked non-essential public officials not to come to work amid fuel shortage. Authorities have also announced nationwide power cuts of up to four hours a day because they cannot supply enough fuel to power generating stations. Sri Lanka is now almost without gasoline and faces an acute shortage of other fuels.

168.title: Hardik Patel quit Congress fearing jail in sedition cases: Jagdish Thakor
168.article_body: After Hardik Patel resigned from Congress on Wednesday, the party's Gujarat chief Jagdish Thakor claimed, "Hardik feared that he may have to go to jail in sedition cases if he stays in the Congress." "Hence, to save himself from the possible punishment, he decided to quit the Congress and he might join the BJP as well," he added.

169.title: Pune Police transfers Ruby Hall Clinic case to crime branch
169.article_body: The Pune Police have transferred the alleged kidney transplant malpractice case at the city's Ruby Hall Clinic to the crime branch unit on Thursday. "They (crime branch) have taken the case papers today (Thursday)," said Additional Commissioner of Police (Crime) Ramnath Pokale. Notably, the FIR names 15 persons, with the police having arrested two middlemen so far.

170.title: Air India plane makes emergency landing in Mumbai after engine shuts down midair
170.article_body: An Air India flight, headed to Bengaluru, made an emergency landing in Mumbai soon after take-off on Thursday morning after one of its engines shut down midair. "The aircraft came back due to a technical glitch. Our...teams have started looking into it. Meanwhile, another aircraft was arranged for passengers to fly to Bengaluru," Air India spokesperson said.

171.title: Man stabs woman to death at Goa beach for ending relationship, held
171.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested for allegedly stabbing a 19-year-old woman to death at Goa's Velsao beach after she refused to continue relationship with him, police said. The accused was arrested a day after the woman's body was found in the bushes by the beach. "The accused was in love with woman, who was studying in a college," police added.

172.title: While other kids went to play, Rimmi & I worked: Celina recalls modelling days
172.article_body: Actress Celina Jaitly took to Instagram to share throwback pictures from her modelling days with her school friend, actress Rimmi Sen. Celina, who started modelling at the age of 16, wrote, "While other kids went to play after school and on weekends, Rimmi and I went to work." "I think sometimes we even studied on our shoots," she further wrote.

173.title: Twitter to label false tweets on Ukraine, disable likes, retweets
173.article_body: Twitter has announced that it will start putting misleading and false posts regarding the conflict in Ukraine behind a warning notice and limit their spread. The platform will not amplify or recommend such tweets and likes, retweets and shares will be disabled.
