It'll prioritise adding labels to misleading tweets from high-profile accounts such as verified users or official government profiles.

174.title: Pune Customs intercept vehicle near temple, seize 51 kg marijuana
174.article_body: Pune Customs said on Thursday that its Narcotics Cell intercepted a vehicle near the Khandoba Temple in Jejuri and seized 51 kg of marijuana from it. Two people have been arrested in the matter. On searching the vehicle, three gunny bags were found concealed below the passenger seat and the marijuana was recovered, Pune Customs Deputy Commissioner Himani Dhamija said.

175.title: SP leader Azam Khan released from Sitapur jail after 27 months
175.article_body: Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan was released from UP's Sitapur district jail on Friday, a day after Supreme Court granted him interim bail in an alleged case of cheating. SC also gave Khan two weeks to apply for regular bail before the concerned court. Khan had been in jail for the last 27 months in connection with several cases.

176.title: Sidhu seeks few weeks' time from SC to surrender in 1988 road rage case
176.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu has sought a few weeks' time from Supreme Court to surrender in the 1988 road rage case citing some "medical conditions". SC asked Sidhu's lawyer to move a proper application and mention it before the CJI bench. This comes a day after Sidhu was sentenced to one year in jail in connection with the case.

177.title: Vijay meets T'gana CM K Chandrashekar Rao amid Thalapathy 66 shoot in Hyd
177.article_body: Actor Vijay, who is currently shooting for his upcoming project with filmmaker Vamshi Paidipally, met Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Wednesday. Vijay met the CM along with Vamshi at Pragathi Bhavan in Hyderabad. The project, tentatively titled 'Thalapathy 66', also stars Rashmika Mandanna and Sarath Kumar, among others.

178.title: He is drunk in appeasement politics: Maurya on Akhilesh's remark on temples
178.article_body: Reacting to SP chief Akhilesh Yadav's remark on temples, UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya said that he is drunk in "appeasement politics". "Akhilesh Yadav ji has forgotten the essence of 'sanatan' Hinduism," Maurya added. Earlier, Akhilesh said, "Just by placing a rock, a red flag under a pipal tree it becomes a temple in the Hindu religion."

179.title: Akasa Air's launch may be postponed over delay in aircraft delivery
179.article_body: The launch of billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air is likely to be delayed further as the airline expects to receive its first aircraft in June or July, as per a DGCA official. Akasa Air had initially planned to start its operations in June. Akasa Air has said it intends to start commercial operations in July.

180.title: Google deceptively collects data in Incognito mode: US lawsuit
180.article_body: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton filed an amended privacy lawsuit against Google accusing it of collecting data of users who think they can be anonymous if they use the Incognito mode. "In reality, Google deceptively collects an array of personal data even when a user has engaged Incognito mode," the suit alleges. "We...will vigorously defend ourselves," Google has said.

181.title: Told Rahul to expel Sidhu, Jakhar but he didn't listen: Sukhjinder Randhawa
181.article_body: Congress leader and former Deputy CM of Punjab Sukhjinder Singh Randhawa on Thursday claimed that he had told the Congress leadership, including Rahul Gandhi, in February to expel both Navjot Singh Sidhu and Sunil Jakhar from the party. However, Rahul Gandhi did not listen to him, Randhawa said. "What Congress couldn't do, Supreme Court has done today," Randhawa added.

182.title: 1955 Mercedes-Benz car sold for record-breaking ₹1,100 crore in Germany
182.article_body: A 1955 Mercedes-Benz 300 SLR Uhlenhaut Coupé sold for €135 million (over ₹1,100 crore) in a secret auction in Germany on May 5, Mercedes-Benz Chairman Ola Källenius has confirmed. The sale broke the previous public record of $48.4 million paid in 2018 for a 1962 Ferrari 250 GTO at an RM Sotheby’s auction.

183.title: You can't abuse Adani or Ambani every time: Hardik Patel to Congress
183.article_body: Patidar leader Hardik Patel on Thursday criticised the Congress for purportedly "taking out anger" over PM Narendra Modi being from Gujarat on businessmen like Mukesh Ambani and Gautam Adani. "A businessman rises due to his or her own hard work. [Congress] can't abuse Adani or Ambani every time," he added. This comes after Patel resigned from the Congress on Wednesday.

184.title: Pune-Delhi SpiceJet flight delayed by 7 hrs due to operational reasons
184.article_body: A Pune-Delhi SpiceJet flight got delayed by 7 hours in its take-off from the Pune airport in Lohegaon on Wednesday due to "operational reasons". The flight was supposed to take-off at 5.35 pm but got as late as 12:30 am. "SpiceJet flight SG 8184 was delayed...Passengers were informed about the revised departure time at 2 pm," a SpiceJet spokesperson said.

185.title: Russia using food as a weapon in Ukraine: US
185.article_body: US State Secretary Antony Blinken said Russia is "using food as a weapon" in Ukraine. "The food supply for millions of Ukrainians and millions more around the world has quite literally been held hostage by the Russian military," he added. Reacting to Blinken's allegations, a senior Russian official said Russians "weren't idiots" and wouldn't export food amid tough sanctions.

186.title: BJP has encroached on government land in Delhi: AAP
186.article_body: AAP on Thursday released a list of BJP leaders accusing them of encroaching on government land in Delhi and asked when the party would run bulldozers over their illegal construction. "We've photographic evidence of residences of BJP leaders...which clearly shows encroachment, illegal occupation of government land and unauthorised constructions," said Saurabh Bharadwaj, Chief Spokesperson, AAP.

187.title: Domestic help beaten up by couple, found in pool of urine in Delhi
187.article_body: A 48-year-old woman, who worked as domestic help, was allegedly beaten up by her employers in Delhi's Rajouri Garden, police said. "The couple dropped her at my office...Later, I found her lying in her own urine and saw that she couldn't move," her placement agency's owner said. The victim's employers also allegedly chopped off her hair, police added.

188.title: Attacks on me should be seen via political lens: Musk after sexual misconduct claims
188.article_body: Tesla CEO on Friday tweeted, "Attacks against me should be viewed through a political lens...this is their standard (despicable) playbook...But nothing will deter me from fighting for a good future and your right to free speech." Musk's tweet comes after a report claimed that he allegedly sexually harassed a flight attendant, who worked for SpaceX's corporate jet in 2016.

189.title: TN Cong protest over Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict's release
189.article_body: Tamil Nadu Congress Committee on Thursday held silent protests in parts of the state over the release of AG Perarivalan, one of the convicts in late PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case. Party workers covered their mouths with a white cloth during the protests. Congress should "withdraw its support to DMK government" over the issue, state BJP chief K Annamalai said.

190.title: 2 policemen electrocuted on paddy field in Kerala
190.article_body: Two policemen died of electrocution on a paddy field near their camp in Kerala's Palakkad on Thursday. According to police, the victims, Ashokan and Mohandas, came in contact with a live wire trap laid to catch wild boars that enter the field to eat up the crops. Two locals have been arrested for their alleged involvement in laying the trap.

191.title: Health is the real wealth, don’t miss out on health investment: Diataal
191.article_body: Diataal has been relaunched in the market with Bollywood's mother-son duo Neetu Kapoor & Ranbir Kapoor. They've come together to endorse a brand for the first time. The brand said, Diataal takes care of 16 vital vitamins & minerals to ensure overall well-being and taking 1 Diataal daily after meals is your first step towards good health and well-being.

192.title: Pak bans imports of all non-essential luxury items to stabilise economy
192.article_body: Pakistan has banned the import of all non-essential luxury items in order to stabilise its economy, said the information minister on Thursday. The items included in the ban are cars, mobile phones, home appliances and cosmetics. Amid declining foreign exchange reserves, the minister said, "There is an emergency situation in the country."

193.title: Kangana Ranaut buys Mercedes Maybach S680 worth over ₹3 crore
193.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut has bought a Mercedes Maybach S680 worth over ₹3 crore. She unveiled her new car in front of the paparazzi on Thursday, ahead of the screening of her upcoming movie 'Dhaakad' in Mumbai. Kangana attended the premiere of 'Dhaakad' with her parents, sister Rangoli Chandel, brother Aksht Ranaut and sister-in-law Ritu Sangwan.

194.title: Samsung leader excused from trial hearing ahead of Biden's plant visit
194.article_body: Samsung leader Jay Y Lee has been excused from attending an accounting fraud trial hearing on Friday, ahead of US President Joe Biden's tour of a Samsung plant in South Korea. Lee is expected to accompany Biden during his tour of the plant in Pyeongtaek. The plant is expected to be Biden's first stop on his trip to South Korea.

195.title: Drive against illegal parking launched by traffic police in Noida
195.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Traffic Police launched a drive against illegal parking in the district. The officials removed illegally parked vehicles from several areas including Model Town crossing, Surajpur and Pari Chowk. "In some areas...vehicles are parked along roads, leading to traffic jams...We request residents to visit our Twitter page to complain about congested stretches," an official said.

196.title: Virat Kohli consoles angry Matthew Wade after controversial dismissal, pics go viral
196.article_body: RCB's Virat Kohli was seen consoling GT's Matthew Wade, who was angry at being adjudged LBW out despite his bat seemingly hitting the ball. As Wade was walking back to the pavilion, Kohli went towards Wade and put his arm around Wade's shoulder. Wade was later seen throwing his bat and helmet in anger in the dressing room.

197.title: He is a 'pocket rocket': Ravi Shastri on Rinku Singh's 40 (15) vs LSG
197.article_body: Discussing KKR batter Rinku Singh's 40 off 15 balls against LSG, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said Rinku is a "pocket rocket" adding that his knock brought KKR back in the game out of nowhere. "Rinku may be small in frame but hits the ball really hard. [I] really enjoyed his batting," stated Shastri. LSG defeated KKR by two runs.

198.title: 'It's hell there': Ukraine Prez says Russia has fully destroyed Donbas
198.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Russian forces have "completely destroyed" the Donbas region and accused Moscow of carrying out "senseless" bombardments as it intensified its offensive. "It's hell there and that's not an exaggeration," he added. Zelenskyy also accused Russian forces of attempting to "kill as many Ukrainians as possible", repeating that Russia is committing "genocide".

199.title: Jakhar started working for BJP long before joining it: Punjab Cong chief
199.article_body: Punjab Congress President Amarinder Singh Raja criticised Sunil Jakhar for leaving Congress and joining BJP and said that Jakhar's move was "not unexpected" as he had been working for the party long before joining it. Jakhar was doing "Hindutva politics"  and the reason for doing so is revealed now, Raja added. Jakhar was damaging Congress in every way, Raja said.

200.title: India reports 2,259 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 15,044
200.article_body: India has reported 2,259 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,364 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 15,044, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,323, according to the latest data.

201.title: Congress alleges over ₹9,000 cr scam in proposals cleared by BMC
201.article_body: Congress on Thursday alleged a TDR (Transferable Development Rights) scam of ₹9,380 crore in proposals cleared by Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC). Former opposition leader Ravi Raja made the allegations in context of the construction of 14,000 tenements for Project Affected Persons in Chandivali, Mulund, Bhandup and Parel. "There're large scale irregularities in the project," Raja said.

202.title: Bengaluru airport receives hoax bomb threat call, security heightened
202.article_body: The authorities at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport received a hoax call claiming the presence of a bomb at the airport on Friday. Security was heightened at the airport following the threat call. "Today early morning, a bomb threat call was received by the control room. It is being verified by the police. Further details will be shared later," police said.

203.title: Something weird is going on in our universe: NASA
203.article_body: Hubble Space Telescope has reached a new milestone in its work to find out how quickly the universe is expanding, NASA said, adding that data suggests "something weird is going on". "There is a discrepancy between the expansion rate as measured in the local universe compared to independent observations from right after the big bang," NASA said.

204.title: She was encouraged to get licensed as masseuse for Musk: Flight attendant's friend
204.article_body: After a flight attendant alleged sexual harassment by Tesla CEO Elon Musk in 2016, her friend said seniors at her workplace encouraged her friend to "get licensed as a masseuse" for sessions with Musk. She said, "They implied that she'd get to fly more often if she were to do this because she'd be able to give Elon proper massages."

205.title: Haven't worked on Dogecoin for 7.5 yrs, & won't ever again: Co-creator
205.article_body: Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus took to Twitter to clarify that he doesn't work on Dogecoin anymore, saying, "I haven't for 7.5 years, and I won't ever again." "One goal here is just to help people see the cryptocurrency market for what it actually is. Doing so in an amusing way is a bonus," he added.

206.title: Food stall owner arrested for social media post on Sharad Pawar in Panvel
206.article_body: A 34-year-old man was arrested on Wednesday for allegedly posting objectionable comments on social media against Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) chief Sharad Pawar. Earlier this month, Marathi actor Ketaki Chitale posted an alleged defamatory post about Pawar on Facebook. As per police, Kiran Inamdar, who runs a food stall in Panvel, shared a similar post.

207.title: My blazer made by PM Modi's tailors, we've great friendship: Caribbean nation's PM
207.article_body: During President Ram Nath Kovind's visit to the Caribbean nation, St Vincent and the Grenadines PM Ralph Everard Gonsalves said, "PM Narendra Modi's tailors made the suit that I'm wearing today to welcome my friend President Kovind." "PM Modi and I have a great friendship. We're both humorous and have a concern for humanity, peace and security," he added.

208.title: Extreme monsoon may bring knee-deep flooding in Mumbai: Maha Min
208.article_body: Maharashtra Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray said that despite elaborate arrangements underway for monsoon, Mumbai could be submerged under knee-deep flooding if there is extreme rainfall in the city. If there is over 200 mm rain in a day, any city, not just Mumbai will see flooding, he added. "The fury of nature can be stopped by no one," he stated.

209.title: Part of tunnel on Jammu-Srinagar highway collapses in Ramban, 10 labourers trapped
209.article_body: A part of an under-construction tunnel collapsed at Khooni Nala on the Jammu-Srinagar highway in the Magarkote area of Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban. "Nearly 10 labourers trapped under the debris. Another 2 rescued and hospitalised with injuries. Rescue operations going on in full swing. Civil administration and Police authorities are monitoring the situation," Union minister Jitendra Singh said.

210.title: 4 school kids, 5 women drown in separate incidents in 2 Pune dams
210.article_body: Nine people, including four schoolchildren and five women, drowned in two separate incidents at the Bhatghar and Chaskaman dams respectively in Pune on Thursday. The students may have drowned after "failing to gauge the depth while in the waters", Pune Rural SP Abhinav Deshmukh said. The deceased women had come for a wedding to a nearby village, he added.

211.title: Boeing launches Starliner capsule to orbit on uncrewed test flight
211.article_body: Boeing launched its Starliner spacecraft on an uncrewed test flight to orbit on Thursday. The test will show if the spacecraft is capable of carrying humans to the International Space Station. Boeing had attempted to conduct the mission in August last year but was forced to abandon it after some propellant valves were found to not be working properly.

212.title: Policeman caught accepting ₹20,000 bribe in Maharashtra's Thane
212.article_body: The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) of Thane unit arrested an assistant police inspector (API) for accepting a bribe of ₹20,000. According to officials, the accused had allegedly demanded ₹25,000 from the complainant for not registering an offence against the company he worked for. The Thane ACB then laid a trap and caught API Dhananjay Ghange while accepting the bribe.

213.title: Not interested in attending US-hosted summit: Nicaragua Prez
213.article_body: Nicaraguan President Daniel Ortega has said that his government is "not interested" in attending the next month's US-hosted Summit of the Americas. Some leaders have criticised the summit after reports suggested the US may exclude Nicaragua, Cuba, and Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro's government from it. "This summit doesn't dignify anyone, rather, it dirties them...sullies them," Ortega said.

214.title: Politically motivated: Musk on report claiming he sexually harassed a flight attendant
214.article_body: Responding to a report claiming he sexually harassed a flight attendant in 2016, Tesla CEO Elon Musk called the story a "politically motivated hit piece". When asked for a comment on the accusations, he said, "If I were inclined to engage in sexual harassment, this is unlikely to be the first time in my...30-year career that it comes to light."

215.title: B'luru saw one of the heaviest rains in May in 40-50 yrs: Bommai
215.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai visited parts of Bengaluru after rainfall caused flooding and said that it's "one of the heaviest rains that the city has witnessed in...May in last 40-50 years". He added that ₹1,600 crore has already been set aside to modernise stormwater drains. Earlier, ₹25,000 compensation was announced for people whose houses were damaged amid rains in Bengaluru.

216.title: Mumbai records over 5,000 property registrations since start of 2022
216.article_body: Over 5,000 property registrations have been done in Mumbai since the beginning of this year till May 19 which has led to a revenue generation of ₹448.40 crore from stamp duty fees, according to IGR Maharashtra's data. In 2018, total property registration recorded was 6,672, in 2019 it was 6,270, in 2020 it was 207, and in 2021 was 5,360.

217.title: Aurangzeb Lane signboard defaced by BJP Yuva Morcha in Delhi
217.article_body: BJP Yuva Morcha members on Thursday defaced the Aurangzeb Lane signboard in Lutyens' Delhi and pasted a banner that read 'Baba Vishwanath Marg' over it. BJYM president Vasu Rukhar said that if the lane is not renamed, the workers will take to the streets. "A case under the Delhi Prevention of Defacement of Property Act is being registered," police said.

218.title: India responds after satellite image shows China building bridge on Pangong Tso lake
218.article_body: India is closely monitoring the construction of a bridge by China on the Pangong Tso lake, the Ministry of External Affairs said. MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said that the area where the reported construction is being undertaken has been considered an "occupied area" by India for decades. "This is a military issue so I can't discuss implications," he added.

219.title: Rihanna and A$AP Rocky blessed with a baby boy: Reports
219.article_body: Singer Rihanna and rapper A$AP Rocky have been blessed with a baby boy, multiple reports said. Rihanna gave birth on May 13 in Los Angeles, TMZ reported, citing sources. Rihanna and A$AP Rocky have been dating since early 2020. They went public with their relationship in November of that same year.

220.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read as RCB enter top 4?
220.article_body: RCB have moved to the fourth position on the IPL 2022 points table with their victory against table-toppers GT. RR and RCB have 16 points each, with RR having a superior net run-rate (NRR). DC are fifth on the points table with 14 points. KKR, PBKS, SRH, CSK and MI have been eliminated from playoffs race.

221.title: Ed Sheeran secretly welcomes 2nd baby girl with wife Cherry Seaborn
221.article_body: Singer Ed Sheeran has welcomed his second baby girl after having kept his wife Cherry Seaborn's pregnancy a secret. "Want to let you all know we've had another beautiful baby girl. We're both so in love with her and over the moon to be a family of four," he wrote on Instagram. The couple's first daughter was born in 2020.

222.title: Indore's drone startup sprays fertiliser over 4,000 acres of land
222.article_body: Drone startup SkyLane Dronetech has sprayed fertiliser over 4,000 acres of agricultural land using a drone. "We have sprayed fertilisers in...Khargone, Raisen, Shajapur, Rajgarh, Guna and Gwalior districts with...a drone to do a business of ₹12.5 lakh,'' SkyLane CEO Prayas Saxena said. The Indore-based startup received ₹2 crore loan from the central government's Agriculture Infrastructure Fund.

223.title: Musk shares meme, says 'Tesla on my mind 24/7' amid concerns about Twitter distraction
223.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Friday tweeted a meme and wrote, "Tesla is on my mind 24/7" amid concerns that he was getting distracted by the Twitter acquisition deal. Sharing the meme, he wrote, "So may seem like below, but not true. To be clear, I'm spending less than 5% (but actually) of my time on the Twitter acquisition."

224.title: CBI raids 15 locations linked to Lalu, daughter in fresh corruption case
224.article_body: Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has filed a fresh corruption case against Rashtriya Janata Dal president Lalu Prasad Yadav over alleged irregularities in recruitment during his tenure as Bihar Chief Minister. CBI on Friday started searches at 15 locations linked to Yadav and his daughter. This comes a month after Yadav was granted bail in the fifth fodder scam case.

225.title: SpaceX paid $250,000 to cover up Musk's sexual misconduct in 2018: Report
225.article_body: SpaceX paid a flight attendant $250,000 to settle a sexual misconduct claim against CEO Elon Musk in 2018, as per a report. The flight attendant, who worked for Space X's corporate jet, accused Musk of exposing himself, rubbing her leg without her consent and offering to buy her a horse in exchange for an erotic massage in 2016.

226.title: Musk's deal moving forward as planned, not on 'hold': Twitter executives tell staff
226.article_body: Twitter executives told their staff that Tesla CEO Elon Musk's acquisition offer is moving forward as planned and that there is "no such thing as a deal being on hold," as per the employees. While Musk had earlier suggested he might seek a lower price for the deal, executives said they won't renegotiate the agreed-upon price of $54.20 per share.

227.title: Madame Tussauds wax museum to open in Noida next month
227.article_body: The Madame Tussauds wax museum, which had shut shop at Connaught Place's Regal Building in 2020, is set to reopen in Noida's DLF Mall of India next month. "The project is under construction," said a spokesperson from the museum's holding company. The new location has been chosen as it caters to population from Delhi/NCR and Uttar Pradesh, the company added.

228.title: Virat Kohli smashes 73(54) as RCB beat GT to stay alive in IPL 2022 playoffs race
228.article_body: Virat Kohli smashed 73(54) as RCB chased down 169-run target in 18.4 overs to defeat GT in their last league stage match of IPL 2022. RCB moved to the fourth position on the points table with 16 points and are still in contention for a playoffs spot. Meanwhile, PBKS and SRH have been eliminated from the playoffs race.

229.title: Which countries have detected monkeypox cases so far?
229.article_body: Spain reported seven cases of monkeypox and Portugal updated its number of confirmed cases to 14. Italy on Thursday reported its first monkeypox case. One person in Sweden has a confirmed case of monkeypox. In UK, nine cases have been reported and health officials in Canada are investigating up to 13 cases. US also reported a case of monkeypox.

230.title: Odisha groom cycles to wedding venue to protest against fuel prices
230.article_body: A groom rode a cycle to the wedding venue in Odisha's Bhubaneswar as a protest against rising fuel prices in the country. His family and friends followed him on foot to attend the wedding. The groom, Subhranshu Samal, said his family had arranged for an expensive marriage procession. "As an individual, I preferred to show my displeasure," Subhranshu said.

231.title: AIIMS Delhi removes all user charges for tests costing up to ₹300
231.article_body: The AIIMS Delhi on Thursday removed user charges for all tests and diagnostics currently costing up to ₹300 with immediate effect. The charges in private and deluxe wards have been increased and the ordinary private rooms will now cost ₹3,000 per day as compared to the previous charge of ₹2,000, another notification read. It'll be applicable from June 1.

232.title: Big B, SRK, Ajay Devgn & Ranveer Singh accused of 'promoting tobacco' in petition
232.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan, Shah Rukh Khan, Ajay Devgn and Ranveer Singh have been accused of "promoting consumption of gutkha and tobacco" in a petition filed before a Bihar court. The plea has been filed before the court of Chief Judicial Magistrate, Muzaffarpur, by city-based social activist Tamanna Hashmi. It sought directions to the police that FIR be lodged against the actors.

233.title: Hardik Pandya's bat goes flying in the air, lands near square-leg region; IPL share video
233.article_body: On the last delivery of GT's 10th over against RCB, GT captain Hardik Pandya lost the grip of his bat, which then flew and landed near the square-leg region. "I reckon it's a bit sticky and moist out there," commentator Matthew Hayden said. "The bat travelled further than the ball," joked Harsha Bhogle.

234.title: Union IT Minister successfully tests 5G call at IIT Madras; shares video
234.article_body: Union IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Thursday successfully tested 5G audio and video call at IIT Madras. "Aatmanirbhar 5G...The entire end-to-end network is designed and developed in India," the minister tweeted as he shared a video of the 5G call. The IIT Madras-led 5G testbed, built at a cost of ₹220 crore, was inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday.

235.title: Uber to show drop location in advance to drivers to minimize cancellations
235.article_body: Uber India addressed the issue of drivers cancelling rides over drop locations and said, "We're now showing trip destinations to drivers before they decide to accept the ride." It added, "Drivers who meet a predefined trip acceptance threshold will be eligible to get destination information." The feature is already live across 20 cities and will be expanded to all cities.

236.title: Not everything is promotional: Kartik on link-up rumours with Sara
236.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan was asked if reports of his link-up rumours with actress Sara Ali Khan being a promotional stint for their film 'Love Aaj Kal 2' are true. To this, he replied, "No...There was nothing promotional there." "We are humans as well. Not everything is promotional. This is all that I will say on this topic," he added.

237.title: No Maoists in Jhargram: Mamata as she warns against 'fake news'
237.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said there were no Maoists in Jhargram and warned of strict action against those spreading "fake news". "Around 1,000 people who were active Maoists, surrendered and have been employed as home guards or in the police force," Mamata said. She also criticised the BJP government and alleged they were harassing TMC through central agencies.

238.title: Payal Rohatgi & Sangram Singh announce their wedding, to be held in July
238.article_body: 'Lock Upp' contestant Payal Rohatgi and her long-time boyfriend Sangram Singh have announced their wedding. Taking to Instagram, Sangram wrote, "Coming this July...Where we get to say the vows!!! And be wedding-bound!" Sangram told The Indian Express the marriage was initially planned to take place on July 21, however, he said they'll confirm the date after consulting with their pandits.

239.title: India achieving new heights under PM Modi: Yogi Adityanath
239.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said that India has been moving towards new heights in the last eight years, adding that the country only crawled for 70 years. Speaking at Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav program, he said, "This is the first time after independence that the country is taking forward (development) programs under the leadership of Prime Minister Modi."

240.title: Will hold talks with Naxals if they have faith in Constitution: Baghel
240.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel said that he will hold peace talks with Naxals only if they have faith in the Indian Constitution. "My doors are open for dialogues. I'm ready to come anywhere to talk only if they have faith in the Indian Constitution," Baghel said. Earlier this month, Maoists released a statement stating they were ready for talks.

241.title: Chinese President urges BRICS countries to strengthen cooperation
241.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Thursday said that BRICS countries need to strengthen security cooperation and they need to maintain close communication and coordination on major international issues. He added that the five BRICS countries (Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa) should "oppose hegemonism and power politics and work together to build a global community of security for all".

242.title: Go First planning to raise ₹3,600 cr through an IPO in July: Report
242.article_body: Go First is planning to raise ₹3,600 crore through an IPO in July this year as air travel recovers, Bloomberg reported. According to Go First's draft preliminary prospectus, the firm, previously known as GoAir, had obligations of about ₹8,160 crore as of April 2021. Go First will begin adding 10 new Airbus SE A320neo aircraft starting August.

243.title: AIIMS removes all laboratory & testing charges up to ₹300
243.article_body: The All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) on Thursday announced abolition of laboratory and testing charges up to ₹300 with immediate effect. The charges in private and deluxe wards have been increased and the ordinary private rooms will now cost ₹3,000 per day as compared to the previous charge of ₹2,000. It'll be applicable with effect from June 1.

244.title: WHO approves China's CanSino COVID-19 vaccine for emergency use
244.article_body: WHO has issued an emergency use listing for CONVIDECIA, a COVID-19 vaccine manufactured by China's CanSino Biologics. WHO has recommended the vaccine's use for people aged 18 and above. The vaccine has reportedly shown efficacy of 64% against symptomatic disease and 92% against severe COVID-19 infection, it said. Notably, this is the third Chinese vaccine to be granted such clearance.

245.title: Cong workers hold cylinders, protest against inflation in Kolkata
245.article_body: Congress protested against inflation in Kolkata, where protesters held cylinders and raised slogans against the Central and state government. "The Union government has increased excise duty on petroleum products and the state govt has imposed VAT on these products," West Bengal Congress Chief Adhir Chowdhury said. This comes after LPG prices were increased for the second time this month.

246.title: Ukraine to seek compensation from Russia over environmental damage
246.article_body: Ukraine will seek compensation from Russia in international courts over environmental damage amid former's invasion, Ukraine's Environment Minister Ruslan Strilets said on Thursday. "Russian missiles hit our oil depots [and] chemical plants...Forests are burning, valuable protected things are being destroyed," he added. Kyiv has recorded 1,500 cases of destruction of ecosystems, he further said.

247.title: Chhattisgarh man trying to buy a cake online cheated of ₹1.90 lakh
247.article_body: Police said that a Chhattisgarh man trying to send a birthday cake to his daughter in Thane was cheated of ₹1.90 lakh. Police said that the fraudsters asked the man to share his bank account details for advance payment and syphoned money from his account. They repeated the same with his daughter and transferred ₹9,000 from her account, police added.

248.title: Sri Lanka has secured sufficient fuel stocks to last till mid-June: PM
248.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe told parliament on Thursday that the country has secured sufficient fuel stocks to last till mid-June. He added that while replenished stocks are expected to ease fuel demand, the queues at fuel stations "will not completely disperse". This comes a day after government urged citizens to stop queuing at fuel pumps amid forex shortage crisis.

249.title: Johnny Depp admitted to cutting the tip of his finger himself, witness tells court
249.article_body: Raquel Pennington, a witness for Amber Heard, told the court how Johnny Depp told her he had injured the tip of his finger himself during a March 2015 incident in Australia. Depp previously testified his former wife had "thrown a vodka bottle at me and took my finger off". Pennington claimed there "were many times" she saw injuries on Heard.

250.title: Uber India hikes cab fares in several cities, cites rising fuel prices
250.article_body: Uber India on Thursday said, "Over the past few weeks, we've raised fares to cushion drivers from the impact of rising fuel prices across many cities." It added, "This will directly boost the drivers' earnings per trip." The ride-hailing company said the decision was taken after drivers raised concerns about earnings and riders complained of drivers not switching on AC.

251.title: Wade angrily throws his helmet and bat in dressing room after controversial dismissal
251.article_body: A video has gone viral showing GT's Matthew Wade angrily throwing his helmet and bat in the dressing room after his controversial dismissal against RCB on Thursday. Wade was adjudged LBW by the on-field umpire after which he took a review claiming the bat had touched the ball. The UltraEdge, however, didn't pick the edge and Wade was declared out.

252.title: Noida man takes pet dog to Kedarnath, makes him touch Nandi idol; priests to file case
252.article_body: A Noida-based man recently took his pet dog to Kedarnath shrine and shared videos and pictures of his pet touching Nandi idol to seek blessings and getting tilak from a priest. Several people criticised the man's actions, with the temple committee and priests saying that they have decided to take legal action against the man.

253.title: Need to create reliable supply chains: Jaishankar at BRICS meet
253.article_body: Union Minister of External Affairs S Jaishankar, while addressing the BRICS Foreign Ministers' meeting on Thursday, highlighted the need to create resilient and reliable supply chains. He said, "Knock-on effects of the Ukraine conflict have led to sharp increases in the costs of energy, food and commodities." He added this must be mitigated for the sake of the developing world.

254.title: Depp will emerge with his good name: Eva Green on defamation trial
254.article_body: Actress Eva Green took to Instagram to support actor Johnny Depp in his defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard. "I have no doubt Johnny will emerge with his good name and wonderful heart revealed to the world," she wrote while sharing a picture with Depp. "Life will be better than it ever was for Depp and his family," she added.

255.title: US Prez to hold bilateral meeting with PM Modi during Quad Summit
255.article_body: US President Joe Biden will hold a bilateral meeting with PM Narendra Modi on the sidelines of his visit to Japan for Quad Leaders' Summit, US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said. The summit is scheduled to be held on May 24 in Tokyo. Biden will also be launching an economic initiative in Tokyo called the Indo-Pacific Economic Framework (IPEF).

256.title: Sri Lanka lowers amount of foreign currency people can hold amid crisis
256.article_body: Sri Lanka will reduce amount of foreign currency that individuals can possess from $15,000 to $10,000 and punish anyone holding it for over three months, country's central bank said. People must place their excess foreign currency in bank or convert it into local currency within two weeks, bank's governor said. Sri Lanka's facing shortage of forex reserves amid economic crisis.

257.title: India's Nikhat Zareen wins gold medal at Women's World Boxing Championships
257.article_body: India's 25-year-old boxer Nikhat Zareen on Thursday won the gold medal in the 52-kg category at the Women's World Boxing Championships 2022. Nikhat defeated Thailand's Jitpong Jutamas in the final. India have now won a total of 10 gold medals in the Women's World Boxing Championships history, with Mary Kom clinching six of them.

258.title: Video of 'Avengers' star Jeremy Renner dancing in Rajasthan goes viral
258.article_body: A video of 'Avengers' actor Jeremy Renner dancing with schoolchildren in Alwar, Rajasthan has gone viral on social media. This comes after a video of Jeremy applauding actor Anil Kapoor's dance in front of schoolchildren had gone viral. Anil and Jeremy, who featured together in 'Mission Impossible: Ghost Protocol', were spotted shooting for a series called 'Rennervations'.

259.title: Men who are gay, bisexual should be aware of any unusual rashes: UK govt on monkeypox
259.article_body: Amid confirmation of monkeypox cases, UK Health Security Agency has warned "men who are gay and bisexual" to be aware of unusual rashes or lesions. They've been advised to contact a sexual health service without delay if they have concerns. Monkeypox hasn't previously been described as sexually transmitted infection, though it can be passed on by direct contact during sex.

260.title: Need to restructure debts to pay them back: Sri Lankan central bank Governor
260.article_body: Central Bank of Sri Lanka Governor P Nandalal Weerasinghe on Thursday said the country will not be able to pay back its debts until it restructures them. Calling for early appointment of financial advisors and lawyers for the debt restructuring process, Weerasinghe said there is an urgent need for Sri Lanka's new leaders to bring stability to the economic situation.

261.title: Thoko Tali!: Amarinder's party tweets after Sidhu gets 1-year jail
261.article_body: After Supreme Court sentenced Punjab Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu to one year in jail in a 1988 road rage case, his former party colleague Captain Amarinder Singh's Punjab Lok Congress tweeted, "Thoko Tali! (clap your hands)." It is Sidhu's famous dialogue from a television comedy show. The SC had spared Sidhu a jail term in 2018.

262.title: Russia must not win war, Ukraine must prevail: German Chancellor
262.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Thursday described the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine as the "greatest crisis the EU is facing in its history". Addressing Germany's Parliament, Scholz said, "We...share one goal, Russia must not win this war, Ukraine must prevail." Scholz's remarks came ahead of a special meeting of the European Council over the war in Ukraine.

263.title: 2,000 more paramilitary personnel to be deployed in Punjab: CM Mann
263.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Thursday said about 2,000 more paramilitary personnel will be deployed in the state to boost security. After meeting Union Home Minister Amit Shah, Mann said, "There have been regular inputs that some miscreants are trying to create trouble in Punjab." He added that 10 companies of paramilitary personnel have already reached Punjab.

264.title: 'Anek', 'Article 15' shouldn't be seen with commercial lens: Ayushmann
264.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana said his films 'Anek' and 'Article 15' shouldn't be seen with a commercial lens. "They're films that are very important for society...you can't compare these films with 'Dream Girl' or 'Bala' because they are mass entertainers," the actor added. Speaking about 'Anek', he said, "It's an intelligent film. For this film, you need both brain and heart."

265.title: Russian govt to help McDonald's Russia business owner to set up: Report
265.article_body: Russian government will assist McDonald's Russia business' new owner in setting up, news agency TASS reported quoting Russian Industry and Trade Minister Denis Manturov on Thursday. McDonald's said it will sell its Russia business to its current licensee Alexander Govor. Govor will operate McDonald's restaurants in Russia under a new brand and will retain employees for at least two years.

266.title: Deeply aggrieved: Zepto after delivery boy dies in alleged hit-and-run in Delhi
266.article_body: Ten-minute grocery delivery startup Zepto said it's "deeply aggrieved" by the death of Karan Raju (Zepto delivery partner working with Zypp). Zepto said Karan was hit by a vehicle from behind "in what seems to be a hit-and-run incident in South Delhi". Zepto is giving financial aid of ₹10 lakh and an insurance grant of ₹8 lakh to Karan's family.

267.title: Indians living in SL asked to register details with High Commission
267.article_body: The High Commission of India in Colombo, Sri Lanka, has requested all Indian citizens who are currently living in Sri Lanka to register their details on hcicolombo.gov.in/registration. The High Commission has issued separate registration links for NRIs and students. This comes as Sri Lanka is reeling under an economic crisis, which has triggered a shortage of essential items, including food.

268.title: Right man in right party: Ex-Punjab CM Amarinder as Jakhar joins BJP
268.article_body: Former Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Thursday congratulated ex-Congress leader Sunil Jakhar for joining the BJP. "Right man in the right party," said Singh, who quit Congress and formed his own party last year. He added, "Honest and upright leaders like him [Jakhar] cannot breathe in the Congress anymore."

269.title: List of Indian cities with highest maximum temperature on Thursday released
269.article_body: The IMD has released a list of cities that witnessed the highest maximum temperature on Thursday. Rajasthan's Barmer had the highest maximum temperature at 47.1°C, followed by 46.6°C in Churu and 46.5°C in Bikaner and Pilani. UP's Jhansi recorded 46.3°C and Rajasthan's Ganganagar recorded 46.2°C. Meanwhile, both Nowgong and Jaisalmer recorded 46°C.

270.title: I've asked Akshay if I could buy songs from his collection: Bhushan
270.article_body: T-Series head Bhushan Kumar, speaking about actor Akshay Kumar, has said, "He is very passionate about music. He keeps calling for songs from different music composers, singers, or lyricists." Bhushan revealed Akshay has a "pandora box" of 400-500 different songs. "I once asked him if I could buy some songs from his collection, that's how huge it is," he added.

271.title: Female Afghan TV presenters must cover face on air, says Taliban
271.article_body: Taliban authorities in Afghanistan have asked TV broadcasters to ensure that female presenters on local stations cover their faces when on air, an official said. This comes days after authorities ordered women to cover their faces in public. "Yesterday we met with media officials...they accepted our advice very happily," Akif Mahajar, spokesman for Taliban's Ministry of Vice and Virtue, said.

272.title: Punjab CM Mann meets Amit Shah in Delhi, discusses border security
272.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann met Union Home Minister Amit Shah in Delhi on Thursday and discussed issues, including national security concerns and technology infrastructure needed to enhance border management. Centre will provide 10 companies of security forces to Punjab, Mann said. "We [have] requested anti-drone technology...other matters including...Punjab quota issue were also discussed," he added.

273.title: World's 2nd richest man Bezos shares magazine cover he framed as a 'reminder'
273.article_body: The world's second-richest man Jeff Bezos took to Twitter to share an old magazine cover featuring him, and said, "I have this old 2006 BusinessWeek framed as a reminder." The magazine's cover featuring Bezos was titled, "Amazon's risky bet". Bezos tweeted, "The 'risky bet' that Wall Street disliked was AWS, which generated revenue of more than $62 billion last year."

274.title: Hindi has been our national language, we should respect that: Arjun
274.article_body: Arjun Rampal, talking about the national language debate, said, "Hindi has been our national language...we should respect that." Arjun added Hindi is spoken and understood the most across the country. "But that's not taking away from any other language," he added. This comes after Ajay Devgn-Kiccha Sudeep's Twitter row where Ajay had said that Hindi will remain the national language.

275.title: US town shuts down after its only clerk quits over vacation denial
275.article_body: The US town of Passadumkeag, which has about 350 residents, has effectively shut down until further notice after the town's only clerk quit. Christen Bouchard quit after being denied a two-week vacation because there wasn't anyone to take over during her temporary absence. The town can't issue vehicle registrations or inspect homes, and its office is closed since April 21.

276.title: CPI holds protest against arrest of MP Binoy Viswam in Hyderabad
276.article_body: The Communist Party of India (CPI) protested against the arrest of MP Binoy Viswam in Hyderabad. "After the Telangana government was formed they are trying to sabotage everything by using police power and filing false cases and sending people to jail," CPI state secretary said. Viswam was arrested after he allegedly staged a protest while demanding houses for the poor.

277.title: CBI files FIR against WB Minister Adhikary, daughter over teacher appointment scam
277.article_body: CBI has registered an FIR against West Bengal Minister of State for School Education PC Adhikary and his daughter for failing to appear before it at the set time. Calcutta High Court had directed CBI to interrogate them over alleged appointment of his daughter as a teacher in a state government-aided school. Adhikary had mailed to CBI seeking more time.

278.title: Panvel civic body to set up 5 EV charging stations: Report
278.article_body: The Panvel Municipal Corporation (PMC) has reportedly decided to set up five charging stations to facilitate the charging of electric vehicles. These charging stations are expected to be set up along the expressway and highway. At one charging station, two four-wheelers and two-wheelers can be parked for charging. According to Panvel RTO, 1380 electric vehicles have been registered so far.

279.title: Retired army man found dead in his house in MP's Bhopal
279.article_body: A retired army personnel, identified as Mahendra Singh, was found dead in his house in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, police said. The deceased worked as a security supervisor at MANIT and lived alone, the police said. When the neighbours complained of foul smell, the police reached the deceased's house and found him lying dead on his bed.

280.title: Jeremy Renner shares pic of hanging off a truck in India, praises 'beautiful country'
280.article_body: Jeremy Renner, best known for playing 'Hawkeye' in the 'Avengers' movies, is currently in India. He shared a picture from his trip to India, which shows him hanging off a truck. On Thursday, he shared a selfie from Delhi, apparently from his hotel, and wrote, "Many blessings to you all from this beautiful country and culture."

281.title: Woman spends over ₹23 lakh to watch Depp-Amber trial in person: Report
281.article_body: Johnny Depp's female fan named Ivan De Boer has reportedly spent around $30,000 (₹23 lakh) to attend the actor's defamation trial against Amber Heard in person. "I took...whole year's vacation so I could be here for Depp," Ivan told the People magazine. "I'm the same age as Depp. I'm single, so I do what I want to, basically," she added.

282.title: Man booked for raping his 15-yr-old daughter in Navi Mumbai
282.article_body: Nerul police registered a case against a 42-year-old man for allegedly sexually assaulting his minor daughter repeatedly. Police said the accused ran away after the victim threatened to approach the police. The accused, a native of Jharkhand, was working as a cook in a bungalow in Nerul and brought his 15-year-old daughter here a year ago, they added.

283.title: GT to bat first against RCB, both teams make 1 change each
283.article_body: GT captain Hardik Pandya won the toss and elected to bat first against RCB in their final league stage match in IPL 2022. Both the teams have made one change each to their playing XIs. Alzarri Joseph has been replaced by Lockie Ferguson in GT's playing XI, while Siddarth Kaul has replaced Mohammed Siraj in RCB's playing XI.

284.title: Portugal reports 5 confirmed cases of monkeypox as outbreak spreads
284.article_body: Health officials in Portugal said on Wednesday that five confirmed cases of monkeypox have been reported in men, adding that 15 suspected infections around the capital, Lisbon, are being investigated. This comes as confirmed monkeypox cases have also been found in the UK and US. Symptoms of monkeypox include fever, distinctive bumpy rash on one's face and other body parts.

285.title: PM Modi to attend Quad Summit in Japan on May 24: MEA
285.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will attend the Quad Summit in Tokyo, Japan on May 24, Ministry Of External Affairs Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said. This would be the fourth summit of Quad leaders. PM Modi will have bilateral meetings with his Japanese counterpart Fumio Kishida and US President Joe Biden, Bagchi added.

286.title: Frankfurt beat Rangers to win Europa League, end their 42-year European trophy drought
286.article_body: Eintracht Frankfurt defeated Rangers 5-4 on penalties in the final to win Europa League 2021/22. Before going into penalties, the match had ended in a 1-1 draw with Joe Aribo and Rafael Santos Borré scoring for Rangers and Eintracht Frankfurt, respectively. With the win, Eintracht Frankfurt ended their 42-year European trophy drought.

287.title: Anurag Thakur announces incentive schemes for foreign films shooting in India
287.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur has announced an incentive scheme for audio-visual co-production and shooting of foreign films in India with "a cash incentive of up to 30% with a cap of $260,000". He added that foreign films that employ 15% or more manpower in India while shooting in the country will receive an additional bonus with a cap of $65,000.

288.title: Have not yet taken a decision on joining BJP or AAP: Hardik Patel
288.article_body: After resigning from Congress, Hardik Patel said that he has not yet taken a decision on joining any other political party, be it BJP or AAP. Addressing a press conference, Hardik Patel criticised Congress, saying leaders of the party were biased against the people of Gujarat. "I wasted my three years in this party," Patel said.

289.title: Pichai, Aryabhatta have bigger fans than stars & actors put together: R Madhavan
289.article_body: Actor R Madhavan, who's attending the 75th Cannes Film Festival, on Thursday said, "From Aryabhatta to Sundar Pichai, we've such extraordinary stories as far as science and technology is concerned." He added, "We are not making movies about these people...They have bigger fans than stars and actors put together." Madhavan is making his directorial debut with 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect'.

290.title: Consequences of temper must be borne: SC while sentencing Sidhu to jail
290.article_body: While sentencing Navjot Singh Sidhu in a three-decade-old road rage case, the Supreme Court said, "Tempers may have been lost but then the consequences of the loss of temper must be borne." A 65-year-old man died in the incident. The court noted that Sidhu inflicted the blow to the man who was more than double his age at that time.

291.title: NATO has no plans to place nuclear arms, bases in Finland: PM Marin
291.article_body: NATO hasn't expressed any interest to place nuclear arms and bases in Finland, PM Sanna Marin has said. Marin's comments came after Finland and Sweden jointly submitted their applications to join the military alliance, a decision fuelled by the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Notably, Swedish PM Magdalena Andersson has said that Sweden doesn't want permanent NATO bases on its territory.

292.title: Delhi's Ghazipur slaughterhouse shut for harming environment
292.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has directed the East Delhi Municipal Corporation to hold Delhi's Ghazipur slaughterhouse's operating licence for violation of environmental norms. NGT said the plant will be allowed to operate only after the Central Pollution Control Board and the Delhi Pollution Control Committee certify that the slaughterhouse can be operated as per environment-related rules.

293.title: Pune-based AIT's few students fall sick, institute cites heat as reason
293.article_body: Some students of the Army Institute of Technology (AIT) in Pune complained of dysentery, stomach ache and vomiting from the night of May 14, officials said. The problems could have arisen due to high heat and less water intake, an official statement said. It added that outside food was stopped for two days as a precautionary measure.

294.title: Protect 'Brand Bengaluru': SM Krishna to K'taka CM amid rain havoc
294.article_body: Former Union minister SM Krishna has written a letter to Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai, urging him to take decisive steps to protect Bengaluru's image as recent rainfall created havoc in many areas. "The recent rain related havoc has…posed a threat to 'Brand Bengaluru' image which might also send a wrong message to the potential investors across the world," he wrote.

295.title: Over 7 lakh people in Assam's 29 districts affected by floods
295.article_body: Over seven lakh people have been affected due to floods across Assam's 29 districts, Assam State Disaster Management Authority said. Furthermore, nine people have died so far amid floods in the state, it added. Meanwhile, Assam Cabinet has introduced an emergency flight service between Silchar and Guwahati at subsidised rates amid disrupted rail and road link connectivity in several districts.

296.title: 206 kidney stones removed from 56-year-old man in Hyderabad
296.article_body: As many as 206 kidney stones were removed from a patient in Hyderabad's Aware Gleneagles Global Hospitals. The 56-year-old patient, Veeramalla Ramalakshmaiah, reportedly suffered from severe pain in his left loin due to stones for over six months, which was further aggravated due to soaring temperatures. The surgery lasted for an hour, post which patient recovered well, a doctor said.

297.title: Video shows boxer Musa collapsing during fight before dying of heart attack in Germany
297.article_body: A video showing 38-year-old undefeated boxer Musa Yamak collapsing during a fight before he died due to heart attack in Germany has surfaced online. The video shows referee and other staff rushing to help him as soon as he fell down. His opponent Uganda's Hamza Wandera could be seen standing on the other side of the ring.

298.title: Over 3,000 Char Dham Yatra pilgrims stuck as Yamunotri highway caves in
298.article_body: A 15-metre stretch of Yamunotri Highway between Rana Chatti and Sayana Chatti caved in on Wednesday, following which over 3,000 Char Dham Yatra pilgrims were stranded on both sides. Only smaller vehicles were able to go ahead, officials said. Around 24 buses and over 15 minibuses were stopped and the stranded pilgrims were taken to safe shelters.

299.title: Forest fire breaks out near Delhi's Majnu Ka Tila; 3rd incident in 1 day
299.article_body: A fire broke out in the forest area near North Delhi's Majnu Ka Tila on Thursday, Delhi Fire Services (DFS) said. The department immediately pressed two fire tenders to douse the flames. "After reaching here, we saw that there's a petrol pump where a big accident can happen...We have asked for more vehicles which are coming," a DFS official said.

300.title: IB official dies after falling from stage during security check in Hyd
300.article_body: An Intelligence Bureau (IB) official in Hyderabad died on Wednesday after falling from the stage of an auditorium while reviewing security ahead of Vice-President M Venkaiah Naidu's visit. The 51-year-old was taking photographs of the auditorium. He suffered internal head injuries and was shifted to a hospital where he died.

301.title: Kangana & I go back a long time, we won National Awards together: Arjun
301.article_body: Actor Arjun Rampal, speaking about his 'Dhaakad' co-star Kangana Ranaut, has said, "Kangana and I go back a really long time." "We both won our National Awards together in Delhi, and we kept on meeting each other here and there," he added. Speaking about working with Kangana in 'Dhaakad', Arjun said it was "really fun" working with her.

302.title: Investors lose ₹7 lakh crore as Sensex crashes over 1,400 points
302.article_body: The wealth of investors tumbled by ₹7 lakh crore on Thursday as the market's key indices, Sensex and Nifty, tumbled by more than 2.5%. While the Sensex closed 1,416 points lower to settle at 52,792, the Nifty ended 431 points lower, at 15,809. The key indices fell after an overnight selloff on Wall Street, the worst in two years.

303.title: Sameera Reddy shares pics from when she had postpartum stress, says 'Me at my lowest'
303.article_body: Actress Sameera Reddy took to social media to share pictures from the time she was going through postpartum stress. "The pics I shared in this post [show] me at my lowest. I couldn't feel happy however hard I tried after the birth of my first child," she wrote. "You are not alone," Sameera further wrote in her post.

304.title: Rights groups urge FIFA to compensate Qatar's migrant workers with $440 million
304.article_body: Several rights groups have urged FIFA to compensate Qatar's migrant workers with $440 million for "human rights abuses" allegedly inflicted upon them during the preparations for the 2022 FIFA World Cup. Amnesty International, one of the rights groups, demanded compensation "to remedy the litany of abuses committed since 2010". Notably, a letter was also sent to FIFA President Gianni Infantino.

305.title: Sri Lankan armed forces ended war with LTTE via humanitarian ops: Prez
305.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa said that country's armed forces ended nearly 30-year-long civil war in 2009 with LTTE through "humanitarian operation", adding that there wasn't hatred or anger involved in war. "There's no room for racism or any other form of extremism [here]," he added. Rajapaksa's comments came as country marked 13th anniversary of War Heroes Day on Wednesday.

306.title: Sculptures of Gods, Sheshnag-like structure seen in Gyanvapi Mosque: Advocate
306.article_body: Advocate Ajay Kumar Mishra said that several sculptures of Gods and Goddesses were seen in the Gyanvapi Mosque. "Outside the barricading of the disputed area, the ruins of the old temple were found...In the middle, stone sculptures of Sheshnag and "Nag phan" like patterns were seen," he added. Mishra, who was leading the survey team, was removed by Varanasi court.

307.title: 3 arrested, minor detained for abduction, gangrape of 13-yr-old in Delhi
307.article_body: Police on Wednesday said three persons have been arrested and one minor has been detained in connection with the kidnapping and gangrape of a 13-year-old in Delhi. The victim had left her house on April 24 to buy vegetables when her auto driver took her to Okhla, gave her a spiked drink and gangraped her along with two other boys.

308.title: Assam BJP MLA takes piggyback ride while reviewing flood situation, video surfaces
308.article_body: Assam BJP MLA Sibu Misra, who was in Hojai to review the flood situation on Wednesday, took a piggyback ride to a boat on the back of a flood rescue worker. A video that has surfaced on social media shows the relief worker walking in the water. At least nine people have lost their lives due to the floods.

309.title: 2 men arrested for spying for ISI, sharing pics of Army buildings and vehicles
309.article_body: Punjab Police have claimed to bust a cross-border espionage network by arresting two persons. According to reports, Zaffar Riaz and Mohd Shamshad, who lived in a rented house in Amritsar, captured photographs and videos of the Indian Army buildings and vehicles and shared them with a Pakistan-based intelligence officer. Investigations are being conducted to assess the amount of damage caused.

310.title: Thailand star Cindy recreates Alia's Gangubai Kathiawadi scene, shares video
310.article_body: Thailand star Cindy Bishop recreated Alia Bhatt's white saree look from 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. Taking to Instagram, she shared a video of a scene and wrote, "Beyond...epic sets...captivating scenes [and] stunning performances by Alia and cast, which...fascinated...many of us in Thailand." "This film brings to...forefront the much-contested arguments about prostitution vs sex work," she added.

311.title: ASI shuts Aurangzeb's tomb for 5 days amid row over AIMIM leader's visit
311.article_body: Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) has decided to shut down Mughal emperor Aurangzeb's tomb in Aurangabad for five days amid controversy over AIMIM leader Akbaruddin Owaisi's visit to tomb. The tomb will remain shut to protect law and order situation in Maharashtra, Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said. Notably, Agra Mayor Naveen Jain called for removal of Aurangzeb's plaques from city.

312.title: Africa contained many outbreaks of monkeypox during pandemic: CDC
312.article_body: Several outbreaks of monkeypox in Africa were contained during COVID-19 pandemic, Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) claimed. The outbreaks were seen in DR Congo, Nigeria, Cameroon, and Central African Republic, Africa CDC's Acting Director Ahmed Ouma said. Outbreaks of monkeypox in Europe and US are concerning, Ouma added, saying the agency is in touch with European CDC.

313.title: I evolved as a person from a bus driver's son to a confident actor: Yash
313.article_body: Actor Yash spoke about how he got rid of his inferiority complex and evolved as a person from a son of a bus driver to a confident actor. He said, "The battle you've to fight is within you." "People might term you as a small-town boy and say...your English isn't good...But I feel all...this can be learnt," he added.

314.title: Gajraj to play 70-yr-old man with erectile dysfunction in Imtiaz's Thai Massage
314.article_body: Actor Gajraj Rao will play the role of a 70-year-old man with erectile dysfunction in filmmaker Imtiaz Ali's 'Thai Massage'. Sharing a few stills on Instagram from the film, Gajraj Rao wrote, "The coming of age of a 70-year-old man...Sah Pariwar enjoy karein." In the photos, the senior actor can be seen dressed in checked shirts and mufflers.

315.title: KKR will invest in Rinku Singh in coming years: Brendon McCullum
315.article_body: KKR head coach Brendon McCullum has said that the franchise will invest in their 24-year-old batter Rinku Singh "over the next few years". "We will see him progressing...Not too many people can bat like Rinku did and be able to pull games out of the fire," McCullum said. Rinku scored 40(15), which included four sixes, against LSG on Wednesday.

316.title: BJP running 'Tughlaqi Raj', no one has right to freedom: Mamata
316.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised BJP and said that the party is running 'Tughlaqi Raj' in the country. Praising her party, she said that unlike BJP, TMC is a party of "Maa Maati Manush". "They are running 'Tughlaqi Kand' through...central agency. No one has the right to freedom, BJP has ended all rights," Mamata said in Jhargram district.

317.title: BJP holding meeting as it's scared after Cong's 'Chintan Shivir': Gehlot
317.article_body: Ahead of BJP's high-level meeting in Jaipur, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Thursday said the party is holding the conclave as it's scared after the Congress organised its 'Chintan Shivir'. "They are scared...therefore they are coming here," Gehlot said. He further criticised the saffron party for its agenda of Hindutva, saying BJP is doing politics in the name of Hindus.

318.title: Indonesia to lift palm oil export ban from May 23: Prez Widodo
318.article_body: President Joko Widodo on Thursday said Indonesia's palm oil export ban will be lifted from May 23 following supply improvements. The export ban was imposed by the government on April 28 in order to tame soaring domestic cooking oil prices. The decision was taken considering the welfare of 17 million workers in the palm oil industry, President Widodo said.

319.title: SC delivered justice: Badal as Sidhu gets jail in road rage case
319.article_body: After the Supreme Court sentenced Congress' Navjot Singh Sidhu to one year in jail in a 1988 road rage case in which a man had died, SAD President Sukhbir Singh Badal said, "Supreme Court...delivered justice today." "The [victim's] family had been demanding justice for many years," Badal added. Meanwhile, reacting to SC's order, Sidhu tweeted, "Will submit to...majesty of law."

320.title: Notice served to B'luru clinic over actress Chethana's death after fat removal surgery
320.article_body: The District Health Officer of Bengaluru Urban has served a notice to Dr Shetty's Cosmetic Clinic in connection with 21-year-old Kannada actress Chethana Raj's death after a fat removal surgery. "Shetty's Cosmetic Centre had license only to run a polyclinic and dispensary not for procedure they did. They need to submit a written explanation of this incident," the officer said.

321.title: US special coordinator for Tibet meets Dalai Lama in Himachal
321.article_body: United States' special coordinator for Tibetan issues Uzra Zeya met the Dalai Lama at his official residence in Himachal Pradesh's Dharamshala on Thursday. "I bring greetings from our President and from the American people and the best wishes for your good health," Uzra Zeya told the Dalai Lama. She was accompanied by a US delegation.

322.title: Rowdy sheeter, 3 others arrested for plotting robbery in B'luru
322.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru City Police has arrested a rowdy sheeter and his three accomplices, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Thursday. All the four persons were arrested for conspiracy to commit a robbery in the city, Gupta said. Police have seized lethal weapons from the accused's possession, he added.

323.title: Closest ever images of Sun reveal its south pole and 'solar hedgehog'
323.article_body: The European Space Agency's Solar Orbiter snapped the Sun in March this year during its closest approach to the star. One of the images shows the Sun's south pole as seen by the Solar Orbiter. Another image shows a geyser of hot and cold gas emanating from the Sun's surface in all directions that the scientists dubbed the "solar hedgehog".

324.title: Video of Kartik saying 'Ariana Grande looks like Aishwarya Rai' goes viral
324.article_body: During a recent interaction with YouTuber Tanmay Bhat, actor Kartik Aaryan was shown a picture of Aishwarya Rai, in which her hair was tied up in a high ponytail. Tanmay reacted to the photo and said, "She does look like Ariana Grande." Kartik then replies, "Rather, Ariana looks like Aishwarya Rai." Reacting to Kartik's comment, a user wrote, "Totally yes!!"

325.title: Renault unveils hydrogen-powered prototype SUV
325.article_body: Renault has unveiled a prototype hydrogen fuel cell-powered SUV, called 'Scenic Vision'. The car will not be commercially available before 2030-2032 and a fully electric version will come to the market in 2024, the firm said. It added a 16kW fuel cell will extend the car's range to 800 kilometres without recharging and the battery will be twice as light.

326.title: Double-decker bus hits motorbike in UP's Chitrakoot, 2 dead
326.article_body: Two people died after a motorbike was hit by a double-decker bus near a village in Uttar Pradesh's Chitrakoot. The incident took place at night when the bus was carrying a marriage party, police said. Notably, the deceased, identified as Ramanand (28) and Prem Singh (29), were riding without helmets and were residents of Barwara village, police said.

327.title: Ganguly brought in new players, backed them, doubt if Kohli did that in his tenure: Sehwag
327.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag, in a recent interview, said Sourav Ganguly built a new team under his captaincy, brought in new players and backed them through their highs and lows. "I doubt if Kohli did that in his tenure," he added. Sehwag further said that during Kohli’s captaincy there was a trend to change the team after almost every Test.

328.title: Tata expresses 'grateful appreciation' after SC dismisses Mistry's review plea
328.article_body: Ratan Tata tweeted, "We would like to express our grateful appreciation of the judgement passed and upheld by the Supreme Court today." He added, "It reinforces the value system and the ethics of our judiciary." Tata's tweet came after the Supreme Court dismissed the review petition filed by Cyrus Mistry's Shapoorji Pallonji Group over Mistry's removal as Tata Sons head.

329.title: Mumbai lawyer gets cheated of ₹2.38 lakh while trying to pay electricity bill
329.article_body:
A 63-year-old Mumbai-based woman, who is a lawyer by profession, was allegedly cheated of
₹2.38 lakh by a cyber fraudster who sent her a text message asking her to pay her electricity bill. The woman said that she first received a message and later a call from the fraudster who tricked her into revealing her bank details using AnyDesk application.

330.title: Mozambique declares polio outbreak after Pak-linked strain found
330.article_body: Mozambique declared a polio outbreak on Wednesday after the infection was detected in a child who has been paralysed by the disease. The polio strain was found to be the same that was spreading in Pakistan in 2019. This is the second case to have been detected in southern Africa this year after the one discovered in Malawi in February.

331.title: It was a natural pause: Aishwarya on not having a release since 2018
331.article_body: Actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan spoke about why she doesn't appear regularly in films. She said, "What happened in the last two years was a natural pause that we all took. I've always been someone to keep it real, that's who I am [and] that's my sense of prioritising." "I've never [focused on]...'What...kind of perception it might attract'," she added.

332.title: WHO ignoring requests for observer status at assembly: Taiwan
332.article_body: Taiwan Foreign Ministry said that the World Health Organization (WHO) is "ignoring" its repeated requests to be allowed to attend the World Health Assembly (WHA) as an observer. "The WHO failed to stay neutral and professional," it added. Taiwan is excluded from most global groups due to China's objections, as it considers the island to be one of its provinces.

333.title: 65-yr-old man killed in tiger attack while grazing cattle in UP
333.article_body: A 65-year-old man was attacked and killed by a tiger that strayed from the Katarniya Ghat Wildlife Sanctuary located on the Indo-Nepal border into Bardiya village in UP’s Bahraich. The incident occurred when the man was grazing his cattle. A compensation of ₹5 lakh would be provided to the family of the deceased, an official said.

334.title: Rupee closes at new all-time low of 77.72 against US dollar
334.article_body: The Indian rupee closed at a new all-time low of 77.72 against the US dollar on Thursday. It marked the fifth record weak close for the rupee in the last 10 trading sessions. The Indian rupee's value was weighed down by a marketwide sell-off in equities and foreign fund outflows.

335.title: Believed in Himmatwala as much as I believed in Baahubali: Tamannaah
335.article_body: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia has said that she believed in Sajid Khan's 'Himmatwala' as much as she believed in SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali'. "But the one thing about those films is, I don't think I was prepared for either," she added. Tamannaah stated she learned on the job, adding, "That's the beauty of being an actor that you're discovering constantly...you're evolving constantly."

336.title: Schools, colleges to remain shut till May 20 due to floods in Assam's Cachar
336.article_body: The Cachar District Administration has issued an order directing all educational institutions and non-essential private establishments to remain shut till May 20 due to floods and landslides that have recently occurred in Assam. Notably, an Assam State Disaster Management Authority report revealed that 1.19 lakh people in the Cachar district have been affected by the natural calamity.

337.title: Minor alleges she was filmed at Jodhpur club's washroom, moves HC
337.article_body: A minor girl in Rajasthan's Jodhpur has approached the High Court alleging police inaction into her complaint that a person secretly filmed her in washroom of a club. The girl said she is not a member of the club and had gone there with a friend in April. When police were called, the club allegedly asked them to go back.

338.title: Pune residents to now get single helpline emergency number 112
338.article_body: Emergency helpline numbers for contacting police, women's helpline and children's helpline in Pune will now be integrated into a single number. The previous numbers 100, 1091 and 1098 for respective departments will now be scrapped and only the new helpline number 112 will be available, Pune Police tweeted. The decision was reportedly made to provide joint assistance to various departments.

339.title: Man electrocuted to death in B'luru, 4th such case in over a month
339.article_body: A 40-year-old man died of electrocution after coming in contact with a damaged wire in Bengaluru. The deceased was reportedly cutting chicken using a cleaning machine when the incident occurred in a butcher shop. He didn't notice that the machine's wire was damaged and got electrocuted. This is reportedly the fourth case of electrocution in over a month in Bengaluru.

340.title: Universities shouldn't become spaces for ideological battles: Amit Shah
340.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said universities shouldn't become wrestling grounds for ideological battles. "Universities should become platform for exchange of views and not...spaces for ideological conflict," Shah said while speaking at an event hosted by Delhi University. He also said that though some people call India a country of problems, we have potential of finding solutions

341.title: Parents of 6-year-old girl who was shot in Noida donate her organs, save 5 lives
341.article_body: Parents of a six-year-old girl, Roli Prajapati, who was shot by unidentified assailants in Noida, have donated her organs which saved five lives, reported ANI. Roli was shot in her head after which the doctors declared her brain dead. Roli's father Harnarayan Prajapati said, "We decided she would be alive in other people's lives and give others reason to smile."

342.title: Apple stops storing card information for customers in India
342.article_body: Apple has decided to stop storing credit and debit card information for Indian customers making payments for its services. The decision was made in light of the Reserve Bank of India's new card storage guidelines which will be effective shortly. Apple said the unified payments interface or net banking can be used by customers for these payments to avoid interruptions.

343.title: New York probes social media platforms Buffalo shooting suspect used
343.article_body: Social media platforms believed to be used by Buffalo mass shooting suspect are being investigated by New York state authorities. The probe will focus on platforms like Amazon-owned Twitch, Discord, online message boards 4chan and 8chan and other platforms "the shooter used to amplify his attack". Twitch had detected the shooter's live stream within two minutes of the violence beginning.

344.title: Greater Chennai Corporation staffer dies by suicide at office building
344.article_body: A 54-year-old Greater Chennai Corporation staffer allegedly died by suicide on the terrace of an annexure building on Wednesday, an official said. "Office works of the revenue and health department were taking place...A staff of our department found him hanging on the terrace and we alerted the police," official added. Police have registered a suspicious death case, the official stated.

345.title: In Gujarat, it's not only Hardik who is angry with Cong: Hardik Patel
345.article_body: In Gujarat, it’s not only Hardik Patel who is angry with the Congress, Patel, who resigned from the party on Wednesday, said. "There are many leaders and legislators in Gujarat who use Congress," Patel added. "Sitting in power and praising the party does not mean that the party can make them the CM," Patel stated.

346.title: 38-yr-old boxer Musa dies of heart attack after collapsing during match in Germany
346.article_body: Undefeated boxer Musa Yamak has died at the age of 38 after collapsing in the ring on Saturday while facing Uganda's Hamza Wandera in Munich. "We lost our compatriot Musa Askan Yamak, a boxer from Alucra, who won European and Asian championships, at a young age after a heart attack," Turkish official Hasan Turan announced.

347.title: Will help Sweden, Finland if they're attacked before joining NATO: Poland
347.article_body: Poland has said it will help Sweden and Finland if they are attacked before their NATO membership is finalised. "I want to make it clear that in the event of an attack on Sweden or Finland during their accession [process], Poland will come to their aid," said Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki. Sweden and Finland have formally applied for NATO membership.

348.title: 3 parakeets, over 120 other birds rescued from illegal sale bid in Pune
