348.article_body: Pune City Police on Tuesday seized three exotic parakeets and over 120 other caged birds from a person in a crackdown over their illegal sale. On receiving a tip-off, police officials raided the accused's residence in the city's Ganesh Peth area and found these birds. The accused has been arrested and subsequently charged under the Wildlife Protection Act.

349.title: HC sets aside Delhi's doorstep ration delivery scheme, says it didn't have LG's nod
349.article_body: Delhi High Court on Thursday set aside the Aam Aadmi Party-led Delhi government's doorstep ration delivery scheme. The scheme did not have the approval of the Lieutenant Governor and the grains provided by the Centre cannot be used for this scheme, the court said. HC was hearing a plea by the Delhi Sarkari Ration Dealers Sangh challenging the scheme.

350.title: Ex-US Prez Bush mistakenly condemns 'brutal Iraq invasion' in Ukraine speech
350.article_body:
Former US President George W Bush mistakenly condemned the "brutal, unjustified invasion of Iraq" during a speech before correcting himself to say he was denouncing Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
Bush, who's 75, jokingly blamed the mistake on his age. Back in 2003, Bush announced an invasion of Iraq, claiming that the country was harbouring weapons of mass destruction and terrorists.

351.title: Big B, Rajesh Khanna's Anand gets a remake, fan says 'Don't spoil the film'
351.article_body: Late actor Rajesh Khanna and actor Amitabh Bachchan's film 'Anand' is being remade by original producer N.C. Sippy's grandson Sameer Raj Sippy and Vikram Khakhar. Speaking about remaking the original classic, producer Sameer Raj Sippy said that stories like these need to be narrated to the new generation. Reacting to the news, one user wrote, "Please don't spoil the film."

352.title: Sensex falls over 1,400 points to close at 52,792; TCS, Infosys shares tank 5%
352.article_body: The Sensex tanked 1,416 points on Thursday to close at 52,792, while the Nifty tanked 431 points to close at 15,809. The benchmark indices fell following heavy losses on Wall Street overnight. The IT stocks were the worst hit, with the shares of TCS and Infosys tanking by more than 5%.

353.title: Pope's 'need a tequila for my knee pain' video goes viral
353.article_body: A video of Pope Francis joking with Mexican seminarians about needing tequila to deal with pain in his knee has gone viral on social media. Pope Francis has been suffering from strained ligaments in his right knee for months and has been using a wheelchair. Seminarians promised to bring Pope Francis a bottle of tequila.

354.title: Gucci, Adidas face backlash for over ₹1 lakh umbrella that doesn't stop rain
354.article_body: Gucci and Adidas are facing backlash on social media over an umbrella that the companies are selling for 11,000 yuan (more than ₹1 lakh) in China. Gucci's China website states that the umbrella is "not waterproof and is meant for sun protection or decorative use". People posted tweets like, "You gotta be joking" and "Why make it then?"

355.title: SC to not review verdict on removal of Cyrus Mistry as Tata Sons head
355.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday dismissed a plea filed by the Shapoorji Pallonji Group seeking to review the court's earlier order approving the removal of Cyrus Mistry as Executive Chairman and Director of Tata Sons. The March 2021 order of the Supreme Court had overturned the NCLAT order which had reinstated Mistry as Tata Sons' Executive Chairman and Director.

356.title: Depp held dog out of car window & joked to put it in microwave: Amber's sister
356.article_body: Amber Heard's sister Whitney Henriquez alleged that Johnny Depp held their dog out of a car window in an incident back in 2013. "I was scared because...I knew how inebriated he was...the dog was...small," she said. She recalled Depp laughing after bringing the dog back in. "Then he made some joke about putting the dog in the microwave," she added.

357.title: Prof Karbhari Vishwanath takes additional charge of SPPU VC in Pune
357.article_body: Professor Karbhari Vishwanath Kale has been handed over the additional charge of the Vice-Chancellor of Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) as Professor Nitin Karmalkar's tenure ended. Professor Kale is the Vice-Chancellor of Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar Technological University (BATU) in Maharashtra's Raigad district. He said, "I'll try to give maximum time as per the need in both the universities."

358.title: Russia sacked top commanders over Ukraine war failures: UK
358.article_body: The UK Defence Ministry said Russia has fired senior military commanders for underperforming in the Ukrainian war. Vice Admiral Igor Osipov, who commanded the Black Sea Fleet, was likely sacked following the sinking of the Moskva cruiser in April, it added. Russian Chief of General Staff Valeriy Gerasimov has likely lost Russian President Vladimir Putin's "confidence", the ministry said.

359.title: LIC share price down 11% from IPO price, falls for 3rd straight day
359.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) share price fell 4.12% to ₹840.25 on Thursday, taking the total drop in LIC's share price to 11.45% from its IPO issue price. The insurer's shares were listed on the stock market on Tuesday at a price of ₹867, against the IPO issue price of ₹949. The ₹21,000-crore public issue was oversubscribed nearly three times.

360.title: Pic shows Sidhu riding an elephant to protest rising prices before 1-yr jail verdict
360.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu rode an elephant in Punjab to protest against rising prices. Sharing pictures of the protest, Sidhu wrote, "Inflation devalues money of Farmers, Labourers, Middle class families, while earnings remain same." Sidhu was protesting before the Supreme Court sentenced him to one-year rigorous imprisonment in a three-decade-old road rage case.

361.title: Congress sidelined objectivity & prioritised subjectivity: Nadda
361.article_body: The Congress party is neither national, Indian nor democratic, BJP National President JP Nadda said on Thursday. "It (Congress) has reduced to 'bhai-behen' (brother-sister) party," Nadda added. "What has shrunk Congress is their activities. They sidelined objectivity and prioritised subjectivity...Such parties are BJP's threats. We are fighting them," Nadda stated.

362.title: 22-yr-old man booked under POCSO for raping 17-yr-old girl in Pune
362.article_body: A 22-year-old man was booked under the POCSO Act for allegedly raping and impregnating a 17-year-old girl in Pune. The girl's mother alleged that the victim was found 21 weeks pregnant after she complained of stomach ache to her, police said. The FIR has been lodged at the Bibvewadi Police Station.

363.title: Will submit to the majesty of law: Sidhu on being sentenced to 1-yr jail in road rage case
363.article_body: After being sentenced to one-year rigorous imprisonment by Supreme Court in a 1988 road rage case in which a man had died, Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu tweeted, "Will submit to the majesty of law." In 2018, the apex court had found Sidhu guilty of "voluntarily causing hurt" to a 65-year-old man, however, it had spared him a jail term.

364.title: We’re taking collective resolve to build new forward-looking India: PM
364.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said that collective efforts are being taken to build a new India. "Today we are taking a collective resolve, making efforts to build a new India whose identity is new, forward-looking and traditions are ancient and (to) move ahead by taking both new thinking and age-old culture together," PM Modi added while addressing 'Yuva Shivir'.

365.title: With no fatalities for a year, Gurugram's Eklavya Chowk out of 'black spots' list
365.article_body: Gurugram's Eklavya Chowk, formerly known as Hero Honda Chowk, was removed from the 'black spots' lists after no road fatalities were reported at this junction from April 2021 to April 2022. Gurugram traffic police implemented road safety measures at this Chowk after it was categorised under 'black spots' area in the city. 'Black spots' is referred to accident-prone locations.

366.title: Karnataka SSLC Class 10 board results declared, 145 students score 100% marks
366.article_body: The Karnataka Secondary Education Examination Board on Thursday announced the Class 10 SSLC results. As many as 85.63% of over eight lakh students have cleared the exams. Out of this, 145 students have secured 100% marks and 1.18 lakh students have got Grade A+. The pass percentage for girls was recorded at 90.29%, while it was 81.3% for boys.

367.title: Massive fire breaks out in Delhi's Bawana, 17 fire tenders reach spot
367.article_body: A massive fire broke out in a manufacturing unit of a factory in Delhi's Bawana Industrial Area on Thursday. Delhi Fire Services Director Atul Garg said a call about the fire was received at 11:45 am, following which 17 fire tenders were rushed to the spot. The cause of the fire is not yet known and rescue operation is underway.

368.title: 1 killed, 6 injured as fire breaks out at electric items factory in Delhi
368.article_body: At least one person died and six others were injured on Thursday after a fire broke out at a factory in Delhi's Mustafabad area, officials said. Seven fire tenders were rushed to the spot, officials added. "The fire broke out on the first floor of a factory manufacturing electric items," Fire Department Director Atul Garg said.

369.title: We are seeing transmission among men having sex with men: WHO on monkeypox
369.article_body: With health authorities in North America and Europe detecting dozens of suspected or confirmed cases of monkeypox since early May, WHO has warned that monkeypox may spread through sexual contact. "We are seeing transmission among men having sex with men," said WHO Assistant Director-General Dr Soce Fall. "This is new information we need to investigate properly," Fall added.

370.title: Teacher assaults 18-year-old student over fake social media profile in Pune
370.article_body: An 18-year-old student was assaulted by his teacher and associates at a school in Pune after the former allegedly created a fake social media profile of the teacher. The student had allegedly posted some pornographic text on the profile as well, police said. Notably, the lady teacher has been booked under Section 352 of the IPC.

371.title: Karnataka to get AIIMS, assures Health Minister Mandaviya
371.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya has assured the Karnataka government that an AIIMS will be established in the state. The assurance was given during Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar's meeting with Mandaviya, according to a report. The move will greatly benefit the state and further enhance the state's health and medical education, said Sudhakar.

372.title: Video of man laughing uncontrollably during Amber Heard-Depp's trial goes viral
372.article_body: Recently, a video has gone viral online where a court observer couldn't control his laughter during the Johnny Depp and Amber Heard's defamation trial. The video is from Tuesday when Amber was being questioned about her allegations of assault against ex-husband Depp. The man walked out of the courtroom after multiple objections from Depp's attorney Camille Vasquez.

373.title: Owaisi was mum when 2 mosques were demolished in Hyd: Amit Malviya
373.article_body: BJP's Amit Malviya criticised AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi over his remarks on Gyanvapi mosque case and said that he is "communalising" the issue. Owaisi didn't utter a word when two mosques in Hyderabad were demolished to build Secretariat, Malviya added. "Owaisi is not just a communal bigot but a hypocrite who peddles lies planted with fascist media," he further said.

374.title: He mocked Hindu 'aastha': BJP on Akhilesh's remark on temples
374.article_body: Reacting to SP chief Akhilesh Yadav's remark on temples, BJP leader Shehzad Poonawalla said, "Akhilesh Yadav, who claims that Shri Krishna comes in his dreams, has mocked the Hindu aastha (faith)." Poonawalla's statement comes after the ex-UP CM said, "Just by placing a rock, a red flag under a pipal tree it becomes a temple in the Hindu religion."

375.title: Andhra man looking for wife stabs mother-in-law to death
375.article_body: A man looking for his wife, who had left him months ago, allegedly stabbed his mother-in-law to death in Andhra Pradesh's Kakinada district. The accused, identified as Ramesh, killed the victim after he couldn't find his wife at her place. Ramesh's wife, who was away studying in Hyderabad, had left him as he doubted her, according to police.

376.title: Thieves break open ATM using gas cutters in Virar; steal ₹17 lakh
376.article_body: Unidentified thieves allegedly broke open an ATM using gas cutters and stole ₹17 lakh in Phoolpada in Virar East on Wednesday, a report stated. The incident came to light when locals saw the damaged ATM and informed the police about the matter. Meanwhile, police have launched an investigation and are examining CCTV footage of the area to arrest the accused.

377.title: Hyderabad auto driver sentenced to life imprisonment for wife's murder
377.article_body: An auto driver was sentenced to life imprisonment for murdering his wife by Hyderabad's LB Nagar court. The convict, Ramavath Sreenu (43), was found guilty of murdering his wife over an argument at their home in a Ranga Reddy district's village in March 2021. Notably, Sreenu was in a drunken state when he attacked his wife, the court said.

378.title: Tesla vehicle crash that killed three under probe in US
378.article_body: The US NHTSA is investigating a crash involving a Tesla that may have been operating in Autopilot during a crash that killed three people. The vehicle had hit a curb and slammed into construction equipment. This is one of 35 crashes under investigation by NHTSA involving Tesla vehicles in which its Autopilot was suspected of being used since 2016.

379.title: Follow rules or leave India: Government to VPN providers
379.article_body: VPN service providers that are not ready to comply with the new guidelines have the only option to exit from India, MoS for Electronics and IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said. "If you don't have the logs, start maintaining the logs. If you are a VPN that wants to hide...then frankly you have no other opportunity but to pull out," he said.

380.title: Pune's Ashok Dyalchand nominated for World's Children's Prize award for decade
380.article_body: Pune resident Ashok Dyalchand has been nominated for the World's Children's Prize Decade Child Rights Hero award which is given by the World's Children's Prize Foundation. The 74-year-old activist is among the eight nominees, including Ghana's Kofi Annan and Pakistan's Malala Yousafzai, selected for the award. Notably, Ashok campaigns against child marriages through his institute in India.

381.title: Goa-bound SpiceJet flight returns to Pune following technical glitch
381.article_body: A Goa-bound SpiceJet aircraft, which took off from Pune's Lohegaon airport on Wednesday, returned to the city shortly after takeoff following technical glitch mid-air. The flight, which took off at 12:05 pm from Pune, landed back safely at the city's airport, the airline's spokesperson said. The cause of the glitch, however, has not yet been confirmed by the airline.

382.title: BJP 'misusing' central agencies: Mamata over SSC recruitment scam
382.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday accused the BJP of "misusing" central agencies for settling political scores amid the irregularities in SSC appointments. "If someone has committed any wrong...then law will take its own course," Banerjee said, claiming there were many discrepancies in government recruitment during the erstwhile Left Front regime, details of which she would "reveal soon".

383.title: In Bangladesh, people compare me to Bradman when I score a century: Mushfiqur Rahim
383.article_body: Mushfiqur Rahim, who became the first Bangladesh batter to reach 5,000 Test runs, said in Bangladesh, people compare him to Don Bradman when he scores a century. "But...when I don't score runs...I feel like digging a hole for myself," he added, referring to the criticism he faces. "This is becoming a culture...so the younger players need the support," Rahim stated.

384.title: Navjot Singh Sidhu gets 1-year jail in 3-decade-old road rage case in which a man died
384.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday sentenced Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu to one year in jail in a three-decade-old road rage case in which a man was killed. The court delivered its order on the review petition filed by victim's family. The former cricketer had argued that there was "ambiguity" regarding the actual cause of death of the victim.

385.title: 55 space startups have registered with ISRO in 2 yrs: Govt
385.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh has announced that 55 registered startup proposals were approved in the last two years under ISRO's decision to open up its services and partnerships to the private sector. He expects at least another nine proposals to be completed in 2022-23. He also announced that 75 students' satellites are set to be launched this year.

386.title: Bengaluru's RBD layout to get new drain to flush out rainwater
386.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike will soon construct a drain on a public-private partnership model to carry rainwater from Rainbow Drive (RBD) layout to Sarjapur culvert, Mahadevapura MLA Aravind Limbavali said, visiting the rain-affected area. Residents of RBD layout had written to Limbavali on May 10, seeking a solution to the recurrent flooding problems in the area during the rainy season.

387.title: Man gives triple talaq to Chhattisgarh woman over phone
387.article_body: A woman was allegedly given triple talaq in Chhattisgarh by her husband over the phone for purportedly not giving birth to a child. A case has been registered in the matter. "She was tortured by her husband and father-in-law for not giving birth to a child," Bhaskar Sharma, SHO, Kunkuri, said. The woman was staying at her maternal home.

388.title: CARS24 fires 600 employees citing 'poor performance'
388.article_body: Pre-owned cars platform CARS24 on Thursday said that around 600 of its employees have been let go based on their "poor performance" and not owing to any "cost cuts". The company said, "This is business as usual as these are performance-linked exits that happen every year." The company also said that it's in the process of hiring more people globally.

389.title: 14-year-old boy arrested for raping woman with special needs in Pune
389.article_body: A 14-year-old boy has been arrested for allegedly raping a 23-year-old woman with special needs in Pune's Pimpri Chinchwad. "The teenager suspect raped the woman on two occasions, on May 16 and 18, when her family members were not home," a police officer said. The boy will be produced before the Juvenile Justice Board for further action, the officer added.

390.title: China eases COVID-19 test rules for US, other countries
390.article_body: China has relaxed COVID-19 testing requirements for travellers from some countries, including US, Canada, UAE, Serbia and Bangladesh. Travellers from the US will no longer need an RT-PCR test seven days before flying, according to the Chinese embassy in the US. They will, however, still have to take two RT-PCR tests within 48 or 24 hours of their flights.

391.title: J&K Police arrest 5 for terror attack on wine shop in Baramulla
391.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir Police on Thursday said they have arrested four terrorists and one LeT associate in connection with the terror attack on a wine shop in Baramulla. Police also recovered five pistols, 23 grenades and other explosives from the accused. According to IGP (Kashmir) Vijay Kumar, this terror module was involved in several incidents in the Baramulla area.

392.title: Former Punjab Congress president Sunil Jakhar joins BJP
392.article_body: Senior Congress leader and former chief of Punjab Pradesh Congress Committee (PPCC) Sunil Jakhar on Thursday joined BJP in presence of party president JP Nadda in Delhi. He quit Congress during a Facebook live broadcast on Saturday. Jakhar resigned weeks after party leadership had issued him a show-cause notice over his criticism of former Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi.

393.title: UP court allows lawsuit seeking removal of Shahi Idgah Mosque near Krishna Janmabhoomi
393.article_body: A court in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura on Thursday allowed a lawsuit seeking removal of the Shahi Idgah Masjid from the Krishna Janmabhoomi, informed lawyer Hari Shankar Jain to PTI. The lawsuit seeks the removal of the 17th century Shahi Idgah Masjid from the Katra Keshav Dev Temple, claiming the mosque has been built at the birthplace of Lord Krishna.

394.title: Few people are using it to settle personal scores: Gulshan on nepotism debate
394.article_body: After Zoya Akhtar’s ‘The Archies’ reignited nepotism debate, actor Gulshan Devaiah shared his opinion on it. He tweeted, “The nepotism debate harnesses the angst...many have from within and outside the Hindi entertainment industry to serve the interests of a few who use it to settle personal scores.” “Film production is a private business. It’s not based on merit,” Gulshan added.

395.title: 19-yr-old who tracks Musk's jet claims he has found Zuckerberg's new aircraft
395.article_body: Jack Sweeney, the 19-year-old who tracks Elon Musk's jet, on Wednesday tweeted, "We've found Mark Zuckerberg's jet N68885. Numerous trips point it being his." Sweeney shared a picture of the aircraft. In February, Sweeney began tracking and sharing updates on what he said was Zuckerberg's private jet. In April, he said the aircraft was no longer being used by Zuckerberg.

396.title: IMD issues orange alert in 12 of 14 districts in Kerala amid heavy rains
396.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert in 12 of 14 districts in Kerala amid heavy rains. The alert was issued in all districts except Thiruvananthapuram and Kollam for Thursday. The cyclonic circulation over northern Tamil Nadu and adjoining areas would lead to isolated very heavy rainfall in several parts of Kerala, the state Disaster Management Authority said.

397.title: Sri Lanka CID interrogates 4 MPs over violence during protests
397.article_body: Sri Lanka Police's Criminal Investigation Department (CID) on Wednesday questioned four Members of Parliament (MPs) over the violence amid protests owing to the economic crisis. Many protesters were allegedly attacked by government supporters in Colombo. The CID recorded statements of ex-ministers Rohitha Abeygunawardena and CB Rathnayake and MPs Sahan Pradeep and Sanjeeva Edirimanna.

398.title: Getty Images to launch NFTs derived from its library of 465 mn images
398.article_body: Getty Images has entered into an agreement with Candy Digital to develop a diverse portfolio of NFT products and collections. The NFTs will be derived from the platform's library of "more than 465 million images", including over 135 million analogue images from Getty Images' photographic archive. Many of the analogue archival photographs have never been seen before by the public.

399.title: No improvement in J&K's security after Article 370 abrogation: Omar Abdullah
399.article_body: National Conference Vice President Omar Abdullah on Wednesday said there has been no improvement in the security situation in Jammu and Kashmir following the abrogation of Articles 370 and 35A. While reacting to the targeted killings in the union territory, the former J&K CM said, "In this week, three such killings took place. After every few weeks, this phenomenon restarts."

400.title: Speak truth in Cong and big leaders will defame you: Hardik Patel
400.article_body: A day after resigning from Congress, Hardik Patel criticised the party and said that the strategy of big leaders in Congress is to defame the one who speaks the truth. "There are discussions in party that people will vote for Congress when they get bored," he added. "I decided to leave party not with sadness but courage," Hardik further said.
